   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Test the behavior of gen_udp. Testing udp is really a very unfunny task,
   23: %% because udp is not deterministic.
   24: %%
   25: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   26: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   27: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, gen_udp_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   28: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   29: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_udp_SUITE}]) end.
   30: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   31: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_udp_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   32: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   33: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_udp_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   34: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   35: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_udp_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   36: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_udp_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   37: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   38: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   39: %%
   40: 
   41: -module(gen_udp_SUITE).
   42: 
   43: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   44: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   45: 
   46: 
   47: %% XXX - we should pick a port that we _know_ is closed. That's pretty hard.
   48: -define(CLOSED_PORT, 6666).
   49: 
   50: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   51:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   52: 	 init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   53:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   54: 
   55: -export([
   56: 	 send_to_closed/1, send_to_empty/1, active_n/1,
   57: 	 buffer_size/1, binary_passive_recv/1, max_buffer_size/1, bad_address/1,
   58: 	 read_packets/1, recv_poll_after_active_once/1,
   59:          open_fd/1, connect/1, reconnect/1, implicit_inet6/1,
   60:          recvtos/1, recvtosttl/1, recvttl/1, recvtclass/1,
   61:          sendtos/1, sendtosttl/1, sendttl/1, sendtclass/1,
   62: 	 local_basic/1, local_basic_binary/1, local_unbound/1,
   63: 	 local_fdopen/1, local_fdopen_unbound/1, local_abstract/1,
   64:          recv_close/1,
   65: 	 socket_monitor1/1,
   66: 	 socket_monitor1_manys/1,
   67: 	 socket_monitor1_manyc/1,
   68: 	 socket_monitor1_demon_after/1,
   69: 	 socket_monitor2/1,
   70: 	 socket_monitor2_manys/1,
   71: 	 socket_monitor2_manyc/1,
   72: 	 otp_17492/1,
   73: 
   74:          t_simple_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv/1,
   75:          t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv/1,
   76:          t_simple_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv/1,
   77:          t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv/1,
   78: 
   79:          otp_18323_opts_processing/1,
   80:          otp_18323_open/1,
   81:          otp_19332/1,
   82:          otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option/1
   83: 	]).
   84: 
   85: -include_lib("kernel/src/inet_int.hrl").
   86: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   87: 
   88: suite() ->
   89:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   90:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   91: 
   92: all() -> 
   93:     %% This is a temporary measure to ensure that we can 
   94:     %% test the socket backend without effecting *all*
   95:     %% applications on *all* machines.
   96:     %% This flag is set only for *one* host.
   97:     case ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS() of
   98:         true ->
   99:             [
  100:              {group, inet_backend_default},
  101:              {group, inet_backend_inet},
  102:              {group, inet_backend_socket}
  103:             ];
  104:         _ ->
  105:             [
  106:              {group, inet_backend_default}
  107:             ]
  108:     end.
  109: 
  110: 
  111: groups() -> 
  112:     [
  113:      {inet_backend_default,   [], inet_backend_default_cases()},
  114:      {inet_backend_inet,      [], inet_backend_inet_cases()},
  115:      {inet_backend_socket,    [], inet_backend_socket_cases()},
  116: 
  117:      {recv_and_send_opts,     [], recv_and_send_opts_cases()},
  118:      {local,                  [], local_cases()},
  119:      {socket_monitor,         [], socket_monitor_cases()},
  120: 
  121:      {sockaddr,               [], sockaddr_cases()},
  122:      {tickets,                [], tickets_cases()},
  123:      {otp18323,               [], otp18323_cases()},
  124:      {otp19332,               [], otp19332_cases()}
  125:     ].
  126: 
  127: inet_backend_default_cases() ->
  128:     all_cases().
  129: 
  130: inet_backend_inet_cases() ->
  131:     all_cases().
  132: 
  133: inet_backend_socket_cases() ->
  134:     all_cases().
  135: 
  136: all_cases() ->
  137:     [
  138:      send_to_closed,
  139:      send_to_empty,
  140:      buffer_size,
  141:      binary_passive_recv,
  142:      max_buffer_size,
  143:      bad_address,
  144:      read_packets,
  145:      recv_poll_after_active_once,
  146:      open_fd,
  147:      connect,
  148:      reconnect,
  149:      implicit_inet6,
  150:      active_n,
  151:      {group, recv_and_send_opts},
  152:      {group, local},
  153:      recv_close,
  154:      {group, socket_monitor},
  155:      otp_17492,
  156:      {group, sockaddr},
  157:      {group, tickets}
  158:     ].
  159: 
  160: recv_and_send_opts_cases() ->
  161:     [
  162:      recvtos, recvtosttl, recvttl, recvtclass,
  163:      sendtos, sendtosttl, sendttl, sendtclass
  164:     ].
  165: 
  166: local_cases() ->
  167:     [
  168:      local_basic,
  169:      local_basic_binary,
  170:      local_unbound,
  171:      local_fdopen,
  172:      local_fdopen_unbound,
  173:      local_abstract
  174:     ].
  175: 
  176: socket_monitor_cases() ->
  177:     [
  178:      socket_monitor1,
  179:      socket_monitor1_manys,
  180:      socket_monitor1_manyc,
  181:      socket_monitor1_demon_after,
  182:      socket_monitor2,
  183:      socket_monitor2_manys,
  184:      socket_monitor2_manyc
  185:     ].
  186: 
  187: sockaddr_cases() ->
  188:     [
  189:      t_simple_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv,
  190:      t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv,
  191:      t_simple_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv,
  192:      t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv
  193:     ].
  194: 
  195: tickets_cases() ->
  196:     [
  197:      {group, otp18323},
  198:      {group, otp19332},
  199:      otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option
  200:     ].
  201: 
  202: otp18323_cases() ->
  203:     [
  204:      otp_18323_opts_processing,
  205:      otp_18323_open
  206:     ].
  207: 
  208: otp19332_cases() ->
  209:     [
  210:      otp_19332
  211:     ].
  212: 
  213: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  214: 
  215:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  216:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  217:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  218: 
  219:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  220:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  221:             SKIP;
  222: 
  223:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  224:             
  225:             %% We need a monitor on this node also
  226:             ?P("init_per_suite -> start (local) system monitor"),
  227:             kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  228: 
  229:             maybe_display_dgram_qlen(),
  230: 
  231:             ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  232:                "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  233: 
  234:             Config1
  235:     end.
  236: 
  237: maybe_display_dgram_qlen() ->
  238:     maybe_display_dgram_qlen(os:type()).
  239: 
  240: maybe_display_dgram_qlen({unix, linux}) ->
  241:     case max_dgram_qlen() of
  242:         QLen when is_integer(QLen) ->
  243:             ?P("Max DGram QLen: ~w~n", [QLen]),
  244:             ok;
  245:         _ ->
  246:             ok
  247:     end;
  248: maybe_display_dgram_qlen(_) ->
  249:     ok.
  250: 
  251: 
  252: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  253: 
  254:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  255:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  256:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  257: 
  258:     %% Stop the local monitor
  259:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  260: 
  261:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  262: 
  263:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  264:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  265: 
  266:     Config1.
  267: 
  268: init_per_group(inet_backend_default = _GroupName, Config) ->
  269:     [{socket_create_opts, []} | Config];
  270: init_per_group(inet_backend_inet = _GroupName, Config) ->
  271:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  272:         true ->
  273:             %% The environment trumps us,
  274:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  275:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  276:         false ->
  277:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, inet}]} | Config]
  278:     end;
  279: init_per_group(inet_backend_socket = _GroupName, Config) ->
  280:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  281:         true ->
  282:             %% The environment trumps us,
  283:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  284:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  285:         false ->
  286:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, socket}]} | Config]
  287:     end;
  288: init_per_group(local, Config) -> 
  289:     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  290:        "is socket supported and is inet-backend = socket ?"),
  291:     case ?LIB:is_socket_supported() andalso ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  292:         true ->
  293:             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> [socket] do we support 'local'?"),
  294:             case ?LIB:has_support_unix_domain_socket() of
  295:                 true ->
  296:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> [socket] which platform?"),
  297:                     case os:type() of
  298:                         {win32, _} ->
  299:                             %% AF_LOCAL (AF_UNIX) is *not* (yet) supported
  300:                             %% for DGRAM (UDP) 
  301:                             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  302:                                "[socket,win32] 'local' not (currently) "
  303:                                "supported for DGRAM on windows"),
  304:                             {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"};
  305:                         {OSF, _} ->
  306:                             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  307:                                "[socket,~w] we support (DGRAM) 'local'!",
  308:                                [OSF]),
  309:                             Config
  310:                     end;
  311:                 false ->
  312:                     {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"}
  313:             end;
  314:         false ->
  315:             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> [inet] do we support 'local'?"),
  316:             case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [local]) of
  317:                 {ok,S} ->
  318:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  319:                        "[inet] we support (DGRAM) 'local'!"),
  320:                     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
  321:                     Config;
  322:                 {error, eafnosupport} ->
  323:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  324:                        "[inet] we *do not* support 'local'"),
  325:                     {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"};
  326:                 {error, {invalid, {domain, local}}} ->
  327:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  328:                        "[inet] we *do not* support 'local'"),
  329:                     {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"}
  330:             end
  331:     end;
  332: init_per_group(sockaddr = _GroupName, Config) ->
  333:     ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> do we support 'socket'"),
  334:     try socket:info() of
  335: 	_ ->
  336:             ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> we support 'socket'"),
  337:             Config
  338:     catch
  339:         error : notsup ->
  340:             ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> we *do not* support 'socket'"),
  341:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
  342:         error : undef ->
  343:             ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> 'socket' not configured"),
  344:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
  345:     end;
  346: init_per_group(otp18323 = _GroupName, Config) ->
  347:     ?P("init_per_group(otp18323) -> inet-drv specific bug(s)"),
  348:     case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  349:         true ->
  350:             {skip, "Inet Drv specific bugs"};
  351:         false ->
  352:             ok
  353:     end;
  354: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  355:     Config.
  356: 
  357: end_per_group(local, _Config) ->
  358:     delete_local_filenames();
  359: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  360:     Config.
  361: 
  362: 
  363: init_per_testcase(Case, Config0) ->
  364:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  365:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  366:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  367:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  368:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  369:        [Config0, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  370: 
  371:     kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  372: 
  373:     Config1 = init_per_testcase2(Case, Config0),
  374: 
  375:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  376:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  377:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  378:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  379:     Config1.
  380: 
  381: init_per_testcase2(read_packets, Config) ->
  382:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  383:     Config;
  384: init_per_testcase2(_Case, Config) ->
  385:     Config.
  386: 
  387: 
  388: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  389:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  390:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  391:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  392:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  393:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  394:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  395: 
  396:     ?P("system events during test: "
  397:        "~n   ~p", [kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:events()]),
  398: 
  399:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  400:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  401:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  402:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  403:     ok.
  404: 
  405: 
  406: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  407: %% Send two packets to a closed port (on some systems this causes the socket
  408: %% to be closed).
  409: 
  410: %% Tests core functionality.
  411: send_to_closed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  412:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_send_to_closed(Config) end).
  413: 
  414: do_send_to_closed(Config) ->
  415:     {ok, Sock} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  416:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  417:     ok = gen_udp:send(Sock, Addr, ?CLOSED_PORT, "foo"),
  418:     timer:sleep(2),
  419:     ok = gen_udp:send(Sock, Addr, ?CLOSED_PORT, "foo"),
  420:     ok = gen_udp:close(Sock),
  421:     ok.
  422: 
  423: 
  424: 
  425: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  426: %% Send to the empty host name
  427: 
  428: send_to_empty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  429:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_send_to_empty(Config) end).
  430: 
  431: do_send_to_empty(Config) ->
  432:     {ok, Sock} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  433:     element(1, os:type()) =:= unix andalso
  434:         begin
  435:             {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, "", ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx"),
  436:             {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, '', ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx")
  437:         end,
  438:     {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, ".", ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx"),
  439:     {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, '.', ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx"),
  440:     ok.
  441: 
  442: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  443: %% Test that the UDP socket buffer sizes are settable
  444: 
  445: %% Test UDP buffer size setting.
  446: buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  447:     Cond = fun() ->
  448:                    case os:type() of
  449:                        {win32, nt} ->
  450:                            case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  451:                                true ->
  452:                                    {skip, "TC not compliant with socket (yet)"};
  453:                                false ->
  454:                                    ok
  455:                            end;
  456:                        _ ->
  457:                            ok
  458:                    end
  459:            end,
  460:     TC   = fun() -> do_buffer_size(Config) end,
  461:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, TC).
  462: 
  463: do_buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  464:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  465:     ClientIP = Addr,
  466:     ServerIP = Addr,
  467:     Len = 256,
  468:     Bin = list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, Len-1)),
  469:     M = 8192 div Len,
  470:     SAFE = 3,
  471:     LONG = 1,
  472:     Spec0 =
  473: 	[
  474:          {opt, M},   {safe, M   - SAFE}, {long, M   + LONG},
  475: 	 {opt, 2*M}, {safe, 2*M - SAFE}, {long, 2*M + LONG},
  476: 	 {opt, 4*M}, {safe, 4*M - SAFE}, {long, 4*M + LONG}
  477:         ],
  478:     Spec =
  479: 	[case Tag of
  480: 	     opt ->
  481: 		 [{recbuf,Val*Len},{sndbuf,(Val + 2)*Len}];
  482: 	     safe ->
  483: 		 {list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(Val, Bin)),
  484: 		  [correct]};
  485: 	     long ->
  486: 		 {list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(Val, Bin)),
  487: 		  [truncated,emsgsize,timeout]}
  488: 	 end || {Tag,Val} <- Spec0],
  489:     %%
  490:     {ok, ClientSocket} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, ClientIP}]),
  491:     {ok, ClientPort}   = inet:port(ClientSocket),
  492:     Client = self(),
  493:     ?P("Client: {~p, ~p}, ~p", [ClientIP, ClientPort, ClientSocket]),
  494:     Server =
  495: 	spawn_link(
  496: 	  fun () ->
  497:                   ?P("buffer_size[server] -> starting"),
  498: 		  {ok, ServerSocket} =
  499:                       ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, ServerIP}]),
  500: 		  {ok, ServerPort}   =
  501:                       inet:port(ServerSocket),
  502: 		  Client ! {self(),port,ServerPort},
  503: 		  buffer_size_server(Client, ClientIP, ClientPort, 
  504: 				     ServerSocket, 1, Spec),
  505: 		  ok = gen_udp:close(ServerSocket)
  506: 	  end),
  507:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Server),
  508:     receive
  509: 	{Server, port, ServerPort} ->
  510:             ?P("Server: {~p, ~p}, ~p", [ServerIP, ServerPort, Server]),
  511: 	    buffer_size_client(Server, ServerIP, ServerPort,
  512: 			       ClientSocket, 1, Spec)
  513:     end,
  514:     ok = gen_udp:close(ClientSocket),
  515:     receive
  516: 	{'DOWN',Mref,_,_,normal} ->
  517: 	    ok
  518:     end.
  519: 
  520: buffer_size_client(_, _, _, _, _, []) ->
  521:     ok;
  522: buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, 
  523: 		   Socket, Cnt, [Opts|T]) when is_list(Opts) ->
  524:     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> entry with"
  525:        "~n   Opts: ~p", [Cnt, Opts]),
  526:     ok = inet:setopts(Socket, Opts),
  527:     GOpts = [K || {K, _} <- Opts],
  528:     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> options after set: "
  529:        "~n   ~p", [Cnt, inet:getopts(Socket, GOpts)]),
  530:     Server ! {self(),setopts,Cnt},
  531:     receive {Server,setopts,Cnt} -> ok end,
  532:     buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T);
  533: buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, 
  534: 		   Socket, Cnt, [{B,Replies}|T]=Opts) when is_binary(B) ->
  535:     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> entry with"
  536:        "~n   send size:   ~w"
  537:        "~n   expecting:   ~p"
  538:        "~nwhen"
  539:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p",
  540:        [Cnt, byte_size(B), Replies, inet:info(Socket)]),
  541:     case gen_udp:send(Socket, IP, Port, <<Cnt,B/binary>>) of
  542: 	ok ->
  543: 	    receive
  544: 		{Server, Cnt, Reply} ->
  545:                     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> "
  546:                        "~n   Reply: ~p", [Cnt, Reply]),
  547: 		    Tag =
  548:                         case Reply of
  549:                             %% {completion_status, #{info := Tag0}}
  550:                             %%   when is_atom(Tag0) ->
  551:                             %%     Tag0;
  552:                             %% {completion_status, Tag0} when is_atom(Tag0) ->
  553:                             %%     Tag0;
  554:                             {Tag0, _} ->
  555:                                 Tag0;
  556:                             Tag0 when is_atom(Tag0) ->
  557:                                 Tag0
  558:                         end,
  559: 		    case lists:member(Tag, Replies) of
  560: 			true -> ok;
  561: 			false ->
  562:                             ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> "
  563:                                "missing from expected replies: "
  564:                                "~n   Tag:     ~p"
  565:                                "~n   Replies: ~p", [Cnt, Tag, Replies]),
  566: 			    ct:fail({reply_mismatch,Cnt,Reply,Replies,
  567: 				     byte_size(B),
  568: 				     inet:getopts(Socket,
  569: 						  [sndbuf,recbuf])})
  570: 		    end,
  571: 		    buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T)
  572: 	    after 1313 ->
  573:                     %% ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> timeout", [Cnt]),
  574: 		    buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt, Opts)
  575: 	    end;
  576: 
  577: 	{error, enobufs = Reason} ->
  578: 	    ?P("<WARNING> send failed with '~w' - system overload => SKIP"),
  579: 	    ?SKIPE(Reason);
  580: 
  581: 	{error, Reason} ->
  582: 	    ?P("<ERROR> Client failed sending ~w bytes of data: "
  583: 	       "~n   SndBuf: ~p"
  584: 	       "~n   Reason: ~p",
  585: 	       [byte_size(B), inet:getopts(Socket, [sndbuf]), Reason]),
  586: 	    ct:fail(Reason)
  587:     end.
  588: 
  589: buffer_size_server(_, _, _, _, _, []) -> 
  590:     ok;
  591: buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, 
  592: 		   Socket, Cnt, [Opts|T]) when is_list(Opts) ->
  593:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> entry when await client setopts", [Cnt]),
  594:     receive {Client, setopts, Cnt} -> ok end,
  595:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> setopts with "
  596:        "~n   Opts:        ~p"
  597:        "~nwhen"
  598:        "~n   Socket info: ~p", [Cnt, Opts, inet:info(Socket)]),
  599:     ok = inet:setopts(Socket, Opts),
  600:     GOpts = [K || {K, _} <- Opts],
  601:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> options after set: "
  602:        "~n                ~p"
  603:        "~nwhen"
  604:        "~n   Socket info: ~p",
  605:        [Cnt, inet:getopts(Socket, GOpts), inet:info(Socket)]),
  606:     Client ! {self(), setopts, Cnt},
  607:     buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T);
  608: buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, 
  609: 		   Socket, Cnt, [{B,_}|T]) when is_binary(B) ->
  610:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> entry when"
  611:        "~n   expect ~w bytes of data"
  612:        "~nwhen"
  613:        "~n   Socket info: ~p"
  614:        "~n   MQ:          ~p", [Cnt, byte_size(B), inet:info(Socket), mq()]),
  615:     Reply = case buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt) of
  616:                 D when is_binary(D) ->
  617:                     SizeD = byte_size(D),
  618:                     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received: ~w bytes of data"
  619:                       "~nwhen"
  620:                        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Cnt, SizeD, inet:info(Socket)]),
  621:                     case B of
  622:                         D ->
  623:                             correct;
  624:                         <<D:SizeD/binary,_/binary>> ->
  625:                             truncated;
  626:                         _ ->
  627:                             {unexpected,D}
  628:                     end;
  629:                 Error ->
  630:                     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> error:"
  631:                        "~n                ~p"
  632:                        "~nwhen"
  633:                        "~n   Socket Info: ~p",
  634:                        [Cnt, Error, inet:info(Socket)]),
  635:                     Error
  636:             end,
  637:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> send reply '~p' when"
  638:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Cnt, Reply, inet:info(Socket)]),
  639:     Client ! {self(), Cnt, Reply},
  640:     ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
  641:     buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T).
  642: 
  643: buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt) ->
  644:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> await data: "
  645:        "~n   Socket:      ~p"
  646:        "~n   IP:          ~p"
  647:        "~n   Port:        ~p"
  648:        "~nwhen"
  649:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Cnt, Socket, IP, Port, inet:info(Socket)]),
  650:     receive
  651: 	{udp, Socket, IP, Port, <<Cnt, B/binary>>} ->
  652:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received ~w bytes",
  653:                [Cnt, byte_size(B)]),
  654: 	    B;
  655: 	{udp, Socket, IP, Port, <<_B/binary>>} ->
  656:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected ~w bytes",
  657:                [Cnt, byte_size(_B)]),
  658: 	    buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt);
  659: 
  660: 	{udp, Socket, IP, Port, _CRAP} ->
  661:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected crap", [Cnt]),
  662: 	    buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt);
  663: 
  664: 	{udp, XSocket, XIP, XPort, _CRAP} ->
  665:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected udp message: "
  666:                "~n   XSocket: ~p"
  667:                "~n   Socket:  ~p"
  668:                "~n   XIP:     ~p"
  669:                "~n   IP:      ~p"
  670:                "~n   XPort:   ~p"
  671:                "~n   Port:    ~p",
  672:                [Cnt, XSocket, Socket, XIP, IP, XPort, Port]),
  673: 	    buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt);
  674: 
  675: 	{udp_closed, Socket} ->
  676:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected 'closed'", [Cnt]),
  677: 	    closed;
  678: 
  679: 	{udp_error, Socket, Error} ->
  680:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> error: "
  681:                "~n   ~p", [Cnt, Error]),
  682:             ok = inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, true}]),
  683: 	    Error
  684: 
  685:     after 5000 ->
  686:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> timeout: "
  687:                "~n   Socket:       ~p"
  688:                "~n   Socket Info:  ~p"
  689:                "~n   Process Info: ~p",
  690:                [Cnt,
  691:                 Socket, inet:info(Socket), erlang:process_info(self())]),
  692: 	    {timeout, mq()}
  693:     end.
  694: 
  695: 
  696: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  697: %% OTP-15206: Keep buffer small for udp
  698: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  699: max_buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  700:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_max_buffer_size(Config) end).
  701: 
  702: do_max_buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  703:     ?P("create socket"),
  704:     {ok, Socket} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary]),
  705:     ?P("get buffers"),
  706:     {ok, [{recbuf, RecBuf0}, {buffer, Buffer0}]} =
  707:         inet:getopts(Socket, [recbuf, buffer]),
  708:     ?P("buffers: "
  709:        "~n   RecBuf: ~p"
  710:        "~n   Buffer: ~p", [RecBuf0, Buffer0]),
  711:     NewRecBuf = 1 bsl 20,
  712:     ?P("set recbuf: ~w", [NewRecBuf]),
  713:     ok = inet:setopts(Socket, [{recbuf, NewRecBuf}]),
  714:     ?P("get buffers"),
  715:     case inet:getopts(Socket, [recbuf, buffer]) of
  716:         {ok, [{recbuf, RecBuf}, {buffer, 65536 = Buffer}]} ->
  717:             ?P("buffers: expected"
  718:                "~n   RecBuf: ~p"
  719:                "~n   Buffer: ~p", [RecBuf, Buffer]),
  720:             gen_udp:close(Socket),
  721:             ok;
  722:         {ok, [{recbuf, RecBuf}, {buffer, Buffer}]} ->
  723:             ?P("buffers: unexpected"
  724:                "~n   RecBuf: ~p"
  725:                "~n   Buffer: ~p", [RecBuf, Buffer]),
  726:             gen_udp:close(Socket),
  727:             ct:fail({unexpected_buffer_size, Buffer});
  728:         {error, Reason} ->
  729:             ?P("failed extracting buffers"
  730:                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
  731:             (catch gen_udp:close(Socket)),
  732:             ct:fail({unexpected_getopts_error, Reason})
  733:     end,
  734:     ?P("done"),
  735:     ok.
  736:             
  737: 
  738: 
  739: 
  740: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  741: %% OTP-3823 gen_udp:recv does not return address in binary mode
  742: %%
  743: 
  744: %% OTP-3823 gen_udp:recv does not return address in binary mode.
  745: binary_passive_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  746:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_binary_passive_recv(Config) end).
  747: 
  748: do_binary_passive_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  749:     D1       = "The quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog",
  750:     D2       = list_to_binary(D1),
  751:     D3       = ["The quick", <<" brown ">>, "fox jumps ", <<"over ">>,
  752: 		<<>>, $a, [[], " lazy ", <<"dog">>]],
  753:     D2       = iolist_to_binary(D3),
  754:     B        = D2,
  755:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  756:     ?P("open receive socket"),
  757:     {ok, R}  = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {active, false}, {debug, true}]),
  758:     ok = inet:setopts(R, [{debug, false}]),
  759:     {ok, RP} = inet:port(R),
  760:     ?P("open send socket"),
  761:     {ok, S}  = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  762:     {ok, SP} = inet:port(S),
  763:     ?P("try send (to port ~w) ~w bytes (as a list)", [RP, length(D1)]),
  764:     ok       = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RP, D1),
  765:     ?P("try recv (from port ~w) ~w bytes", [SP, byte_size(B)+1]),
  766:     {ok, {Addr, SP, B}} = gen_udp:recv(R, byte_size(B)+1),
  767:     ?P("try send (to port ~w) ~w bytes (as a binary)", [RP, byte_size(D2)]),
  768:     ok       = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RP, D2),
  769:     ?P("try recv (from port ~w) ~w bytes", [SP, byte_size(B)+1]),
  770:     {ok, {Addr, SP, B}} = gen_udp:recv(R, byte_size(B)+1),
  771:     ?P("try send (to port ~w) ~w bytes (as a iolist)", [RP, iolist_size(D3)]),
  772:     ok       = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RP, D3),
  773:     ?P("try recv (from port ~w) ~w bytes", [SP, byte_size(B)+1]),
  774:     {ok, {Addr, SP, B}} = gen_udp:recv(R, byte_size(B)+1),
  775:     ?P("cleanup"),
  776:     ok       = gen_udp:close(S),
  777:     ok       = gen_udp:close(R),
  778:     ?P("done"),
  779:     ok.
  780: 
  781: 
  782: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  783: %% OTP-3836 inet_udp crashes when IP-address is larger than 255.
  784: 
  785: %% OTP-3836 inet_udp crashes when IP-address is larger than 255.
  786: bad_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  787:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_bad_address(Config) end).
  788: 
  789: do_bad_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  790:     ?P("create sockets"),
  791:     {ok, R}   = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  792:     {ok, RP}  = inet:port(R),
  793:     {ok, S}   = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  794:     {ok, _SP} = inet:port(S),
  795: 
  796:     ?P("try send to invalid address 1 - expect failure"),
  797:     case (catch gen_udp:send(S, {127,0,0,1,0}, RP, "void")) of
  798:         {'EXIT', badarg} ->
  799:             ok;
  800:         Any1 ->
  801:             ?P("<ERROR> unexpected result: "
  802:                "~n   ~p", [Any1]),
  803:             ct:fail({unexpected_result, 1, Any1})                
  804:     end,
  805: 
  806:     ?P("try send to invalid address 2 - expect failure"),
  807:     case (catch gen_udp:send(S, {127,0,0,256}, RP, "void")) of
  808:         {'EXIT', badarg} ->
  809:             ok;
  810:         Any2 ->
  811:             ?P("<ERROR> unexpected result: "
  812:                "~n   ~p", [Any2]),
  813:             ct:fail({unexpected_result, 2, Any2})
  814:     end,
  815: 
  816:     ?P("cleanup"),
  817:     ok       = gen_udp:close(S),
  818:     ok       = gen_udp:close(R),
  819: 
  820:     ?P("done"),
  821:     ok.
  822: 
  823: 
  824: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  825: %% OTP-6249 UDP option for number of packet reads
  826: %%
  827: %% Starts a node that on command sends a bunch of messages
  828: %% to our UDP port. The receiving process just receives and
  829: %% ignores the incoming messages.
  830: %% A tracing process traces the receiving port for
  831: %% 'send' and scheduling events. From the trace,
  832: %% how many messages are received per in/out scheduling,
  833: %% which should never be more than the read_packet parameter.
  834: 
  835: %% OTP-6249 UDP option for number of packet reads.
  836: read_packets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  837:     Cond = fun() ->
  838: 		   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  839: 		       true ->
  840:                            %% We have not (yet) implemented support for 
  841:                            %% this option. We accept it but do not use it.
  842:                            ?P("~w:cond -> skip", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  843: 			   {skip, "Not compliant with socket"};
  844: 		       false ->
  845:                            ?P("~w:cond -> run", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  846: 			   ok
  847: 		   end
  848: 	   end,
  849:     Pre  = fun() ->
  850:                    %% Try start/create a worker node
  851:                    NName = ?UNIQ_NODE_NAME,
  852:                    ?P("~w:pre -> try create node ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, NName]),
  853:                    case start_node(NName) of
  854:                        {ok, Node} ->
  855:                            ?P("~w:pre -> node ~p started",
  856:                               [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
  857:                            #{node => Node,
  858:                              conf => Config};
  859:                        {error, Reason} ->
  860:                            ?P("~w:pre -> Failed start node ~p"
  861:                               "~n   ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, NName, Reason]),
  862:                            {skip, Reason}
  863:                    end
  864:            end,
  865:     TC   = fun(State) ->
  866:                    ?P("~w:tc -> begin", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  867:                    Res = do_read_packets(State),
  868:                    ?P("~w:tc -> done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  869:                    Res
  870:            end,
  871:     Post = fun(#{node := Node}) ->
  872:                    ?P("~w:post -> stop node", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  873:                    stop_node(Node)
  874:            end,
  875:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  876: 
  877: do_read_packets(#{node := Node,
  878:                   conf := Config}) when is_list(Config) ->
  879:     N1   = 5,
  880:     N2   = 1,
  881:     Msgs = 30000,
  882:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  883:     ?P("open socket (with read-packets: ~p)", [N1]),
  884:     {ok, R}   = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {read_packets,N1}]),
  885:     {ok, {RA, RP}}  = inet:sockname(R),
  886:     ?P("reader: "
  887:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
  888:        "~n   Port: ~p", [RA, RP]),
  889: 
  890:     %%
  891:     ?P("perform read-packets test"),
  892:     {V1, Trace1} = read_packets_test(Config, R, RA, RP, Msgs, Node),
  893:     ?P("verify read-packets (to ~w)", [N1]),
  894:     {ok,[{read_packets,N1}]} = inet:getopts(R, [read_packets]),
  895:     %%
  896:     ?P("set new read-packets: ~p", [N2]),
  897:     ok = inet:setopts(R, [{read_packets, N2}]),
  898:     ?P("perform read-packets test"),
  899:     {V2, Trace2} = read_packets_test(Config, R, RA, RP, Msgs, Node),
  900:     ?P("verify read-packets (to ~w)", [N2]),
  901:     {ok, [{read_packets,N2}]} = inet:getopts(R, [read_packets]),
  902:     %%
  903:     ?P("dump trace 1"),
  904:     dump_terms(Config, "trace1.terms", Trace1),
  905:     ?P("dump trace 2"),
  906:     dump_terms(Config, "trace2.terms", Trace2),
  907: 
  908:     %% Because of the inherit racy-ness of the feature it is
  909:     %% hard to test that it behaves correctly.
  910:     %% Right now (OTP 21) a port task takes 5% of the
  911:     %% allotted port task reductions to execute, so
  912:     %% the max number of executions a port is allowed to
  913:     %% do before being re-scheduled is N * 20
  914: 
  915:     ?P("read-packets test verification when: "
  916:        "~n      N1: ~p"
  917:        "~n      V1: ~p"
  918:        "~n   vs"
  919:        "~n      N2: ~p"
  920:        "~n      V2: ~p", [N1, V1, N2, V2]),
  921:     if
  922:         V1 > (N1 * 20) ->
  923:             ct:fail("Got ~p msgs, max was ~p", [V1, N1]);
  924:         V2 > (N2 * 20) ->
  925:             ct:fail("Got ~p msgs, max was ~p", [V2, N2]);
  926:         true ->
  927:             ok
  928:     end,
  929:     ?P("done"),
  930:     ok.
  931: 
  932: dump_terms(Config, Name, Terms) ->
  933:     FName = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),Name),
  934:     file:write_file(FName, term_to_binary(Terms)),
  935:     ct:log("Logged terms to ~s",[FName]).
  936: 
  937: read_packets_test(Config, R, RA, RP, Msgs, Node) ->
  938:     Receiver = self(),
  939:     Tracer =
  940: 	spawn_link(
  941: 	  fun () ->
  942: 		  receive
  943: 		      {Receiver,get_trace} ->
  944: 			  Receiver ! {self(),{trace,flush()}}
  945: 		  end
  946: 	  end),
  947:     Sender =
  948: 	spawn_opt(
  949: 	  Node,
  950: 	  fun () ->
  951:                   %% We run on the same "machine" as R,
  952:                   %% so use the same addr
  953: 		  {ok, S}  = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, RA}]),
  954: 		  {ok, {SA, SP}} = inet:sockname(S),
  955: 		  Receiver ! {self(),{sockname, {SA, SP}}},
  956: 		  receive
  957: 		      {Receiver,go} ->
  958: 			  read_packets_send(S, RA, RP, Msgs)
  959: 		  end
  960: 	  end, 
  961: 	  [link,{priority,high}]),
  962:     receive
  963: 	{Sender, {sockname, {SA, SP}}} ->
  964: 	    erlang:trace(R, true,
  965: 			 [running_ports,'send',{tracer,Tracer}]),
  966: 	    erlang:yield(),
  967: 	    Sender ! {Receiver,go},
  968: 	    read_packets_recv(Msgs),
  969: 	    erlang:trace(R, false, [all]),
  970: 	    Tracer ! {Receiver,get_trace},
  971: 	    receive
  972: 		{Tracer,{trace,Trace}} ->
  973: 		    {read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace), Trace}
  974: 	    end
  975:     end.
  976: 
  977: read_packets_send(_S, _RA, _RP, 0) ->
  978:     ok;
  979: read_packets_send(S, RA, RP, Msgs) ->
  980:     ok = gen_udp:send(S, RA, RP, "UDP FLOOOOOOD"),
  981:     read_packets_send(S, RA, RP, Msgs - 1).
  982: 
  983: read_packets_recv(0) ->
  984:     ok;
  985: read_packets_recv(N) ->
  986:     receive
  987: 	_ ->
  988: 	    read_packets_recv(N - 1)
  989:     after 5000 ->
  990: 	    timeout
  991:     end.
  992: 
  993: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace) ->
  994:     [Max | _] = Pkts =
  995:         lists:reverse(lists:sort(read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, 0))),
  996:     ?P("read-packets verify: ~p", [lists:sublist(Pkts,10)]),
  997:     Max.
  998: 
  999: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, [{trace,R,OutIn,_}|Trace], M) 
 1000:   when OutIn =:= out; OutIn =:= in ->
 1001:     push(M, read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, 0));
 1002: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, [{trace, R,'receive',timeout}|Trace], M) ->
 1003:     push(M, read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, 0));
 1004: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP,
 1005: 		    [{trace,R,'send',{udp, R, SA, SP,_Msg}, Self} | Trace], M)
 1006:   when Self =:= self() ->
 1007:     read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, M+1);
 1008: read_packets_verify(_R, _SA, _SP, [], M) ->
 1009:     push(M, []);
 1010: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, [T | Trace], M) ->
 1011:     ct:fail(
 1012:       {read_packets_verify, mismatch, self(),
 1013:        {R, SA, SP, [T, length(Trace)], M}});
 1014: read_packets_verify(_R, _SA, _SP, Trace, M) ->
 1015:     ct:fail({read_packets_verify,mismatch,Trace,M}).
 1016: 
 1017: push(0, Vs) ->
 1018:     Vs;
 1019: push(V, Vs) ->
 1020:     [V|Vs].
 1021: 
 1022: flush() ->
 1023:     receive
 1024: 	X ->
 1025: 	    [X|flush()]
 1026:     after 200 ->
 1027: 	    []
 1028:     end.
 1029: 
 1030: 
 1031: %% OTP-16059
 1032: %% UDP recv with timeout 0 corrupts internal state so that after a
 1033: %% recv under {active, once} the UDP recv poll wastes incoming data
 1034: recv_poll_after_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1035:     Msg1 = <<"Hej!">>,
 1036:     Msg2 = <<"Hej igen!">>,
 1037:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 1038:     %% Addr = {127,0,0,1},
 1039:     {ok,S1} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, once}]),
 1040:     {ok,P1} = inet:port(S1),
 1041:     {ok,S2} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
 1042:     {ok,P2} = inet:port(S2),
 1043:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, Msg1),
 1044:     receive
 1045:         {udp, S1, Addr, P2, Msg1} ->
 1046:             {error, timeout} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, 0),
 1047:             ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, Msg2),
 1048:             receive after 500 -> ok end, % Give the kernel time to deliver
 1049:             {ok, {Addr, P2, Msg2}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, 0),
 1050:             ok
 1051:     end.
 1052: 
 1053: 
 1054: %% Test that the 'fd' option works.
 1055: open_fd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1056:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1057:             fun() -> is_not_windows() end,
 1058:             fun() -> do_open_fd(Config) end).
 1059: 
 1060: do_open_fd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1061:     Msg = "Det gör ont när knoppar brista. Varför skulle annars våren tveka?",
 1062:     Addr = {127,0,0,1},
 1063:     ?P("try open first (default domain = inet) socket and get its fd"),
 1064:     {S1, FD} = case ?OPEN(Config, 0) of
 1065:                    {ok, Sock1} when is_port(Sock1) ->
 1066:                        {ok, FileDesc1} = prim_inet:getfd(Sock1),
 1067:                        {Sock1, FileDesc1};
 1068:                    {ok, Sock1} ->
 1069:                       {ok, [{fd, FileDesc1}]} =
 1070:                           gen_udp_socket:getopts(Sock1, [fd]),
 1071:                       {Sock1, FileDesc1}
 1072:                end,
 1073:     ?P("try get the socket port number"),
 1074:     {ok, P2} = inet:port(S1),
 1075: 
 1076:     ?P("try open second (domain = inet6) socket with FD = ~w "
 1077:        "and expect *failure*", [FD]),
 1078: 
 1079:     OS = which_os(),
 1080: 
 1081:     case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{debug, true}, inet6, {fd,FD}]) of
 1082:         {error, einval = Reason} ->
 1083:             ?P("expected failure reason ~w", [Reason]),
 1084:             ok;
 1085:         {error, eafnosupport = Reason} ->
 1086:             ?P("expected failure reason ~w (IPv6 not supported?)", [Reason]),
 1087:             ok;
 1088:         {error, Reason} ->
 1089:             ?P("unexpected failure: ~w", [Reason]),
 1090:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, Reason});
 1091:         {ok, Socket} when (OS =:= darwin) ->
 1092:             ?P("unexpected success: "
 1093:                "~n   ~p", [inet:info(Socket)]),
 1094:             (catch gen_udp:close(Socket)),
 1095:             (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 1096:             skip(unexpected_succes);
 1097:         {ok, Socket} ->
 1098:             ?P("unexpected success: "
 1099:                "~n   ~p", [inet:info(Socket)]),
 1100:             (catch gen_udp:close(Socket)),
 1101:             (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 1102:             ct:fail(unexpected_succes)
 1103:     end,
 1104: 
 1105:     ?P("try open second socket with FD = ~w "
 1106:        "and expect success", [FD]),
 1107:     {ok, S2} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{fd, FD}]),
 1108:     {ok, P2} = inet:port(S2),
 1109: 
 1110:     ?P("try open third socket and expect success"),
 1111:     {ok, S3} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
 1112:     {ok, P3} = inet:port(S3),
 1113: 
 1114:     ?P("try send message from socket 3 to socket 2 (~w)", [P2]),
 1115:     ok = gen_udp:send(S3, Addr, P2, Msg),
 1116:     receive
 1117: 	{udp, S2, Addr, P3, Msg} ->
 1118:             ?P("expected recv - "
 1119:                "try send message from socket 2 to socket 3 (~w)", [P3]),
 1120: 	    ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P3, Msg),
 1121: 	    receive
 1122: 		{udp, S3, Addr, P2, Msg} ->
 1123:                     ?P("expected recv - done"),
 1124: 		    ok
 1125: 	    after 1000 ->
 1126:                     ?P("unexpected timeout"),
 1127: 		    ct:fail(io_lib:format("~w", [flush()]))
 1128: 	    end
 1129:     after 1000 ->
 1130:             ?P("unexpected timeout"),
 1131: 	    ct:fail(io_lib:format("~w", [flush()]))
 1132:     end,
 1133:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1134:     (catch gen_udp:close(S3)),
 1135:     (catch gen_udp:close(S2)),
 1136:     (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 1137:     ?P("done"),
 1138:     ok.
 1139: 
 1140: active_n(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1141:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_active_n(Config) end).
 1142: 
 1143: do_active_n(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1144:     N = 3,
 1145:     ?P("create socket (1) with active = ~w", [N]),
 1146:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 1147:     S1 = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,N}])),
 1148:     ?P("verify socket active = ~w (~p)", [N, which_info(S1)]),
 1149:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1150: 
 1151:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect passive", [-N]),
 1152:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,-N}]),
 1153:     receive
 1154:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1155:             ?P("expected passive received"),
 1156:             ok
 1157:     after
 1158:         5000 ->
 1159:             ?P("ERROR: passive *not* received"),
 1160:             exit({error,udp_passive_failure})
 1161:     end,
 1162:     ?P("verify socket active passive (=false) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1163:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1164: 
 1165:     ?P("set active = 0 and expect passive message"),
 1166:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active, 0}]),
 1167:     receive
 1168:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1169:             ?P("expected passive received"),
 1170:             ok
 1171:     after
 1172:         5000 ->
 1173:             ?P("ERROR: passive *not* received"),
 1174:             exit({error,udp_passive_failure})
 1175:     end,
 1176: 
 1177:     ?P("set active = 32767 (=max) and expect success"),
 1178:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,32767}]),
 1179:     ?P("try set active = 1 (already at max) and expect failure (einval)"),
 1180:     {error, einval} = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,1}]),
 1181:     ?P("set active = -32769 (<min) and expect failure (einval)"),
 1182:     {error, einval} = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,-32769}]),
 1183:     ?P("set active = -32768 and expect passive message"),
 1184:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,-32768}]),
 1185:     receive
 1186:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1187:             ?P("expected passive received"),
 1188:             ok
 1189:     after
 1190:         5000 ->
 1191:             ?P("ERROR: passive *not* received"),
 1192:             exit({error,udp_passive_failure})
 1193:     end,
 1194: 
 1195:     ?P("verify socket active passive (=false), (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1196:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1197:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [N]),
 1198:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,N}]),
 1199:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [true]),
 1200:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,true}]),
 1201:     ?P("verify socket active active (=true) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1202:     [{active,true}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1203:     ?P("verify nothing in the message queue"),
 1204:     receive
 1205:         Unexpected_1 ->
 1206:             ?P("ERROR: something in the message queue: "
 1207:                "~n   ~p", [Unexpected_1]),
 1208:             exit({error, active_n, Unexpected_1})
 1209:     after
 1210:         0 ->
 1211:             ?P("nothing in the message queue"),
 1212:             ok
 1213:     end,
 1214: 
 1215:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [N]),
 1216:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,N}]),
 1217:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [once]),
 1218:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,once}]),
 1219:     ?P("verify socket active active (=once) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1220:     [{active,once}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1221:     receive
 1222:         Unexpected_2 ->
 1223:             ?P("ERROR: something in the message queue: "
 1224:                "~n   ~p", [Unexpected_2]),
 1225:             exit({error,active_n, Unexpected_2})
 1226:     after
 1227:         0 ->
 1228:             ?P("nothing in the message queue"),
 1229:             ok
 1230:     end,
 1231: 
 1232:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect failure (einval)", [32768]),
 1233:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,32768}]),
 1234:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [false]),
 1235:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,false}]),
 1236:     ?P("verify socket active passive (=false) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1237:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1238: 
 1239:      %% S1Port = ok(inet:port(S1)),
 1240:     {S1Addr, S1Port} = ok(inet:sockname(S1)),
 1241:     ?P("S1 sockname: "
 1242:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 1243:        "~n   Port: ~p", [S1Addr, S1Port]),
 1244: 
 1245:     ?P("create socket (2) with active = ~w", [N]),
 1246:     S2 = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,N}])),
 1247: 
 1248:     %% S2Port = ok(inet:port(S2)),
 1249:     {S2Addr, S2Port} = ok(inet:sockname(S2)),
 1250:     ?P("S2 sockname: "
 1251:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 1252:        "~n   Port: ~p", [S2Addr, S2Port]),
 1253: 
 1254:     ?P("verify socket (2) active = ~w (~p)", [N, which_info(S2)]),
 1255:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S2, [active])),
 1256:     ?P("set socket (1) active = ~w and expect success", [N]),
 1257:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,N}]),
 1258:     ?P("verify socket (1) active = ~w (~p)", [N, which_info(S1)]),
 1259:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1260:     ?P("generate ~w message(s) and send them: S1 -> S2 and S2 -> S1 when:"
 1261:        "~n   Socket 1 info: ~p"
 1262:        "~n   Socket 2 info: ~p", [N, inet:info(S1), inet:info(S2)]),
 1263:     lists:foreach(
 1264:       fun(I) ->
 1265:               Msg = "message "++integer_to_list(I),
 1266:               ?P("send message ~w from S2 to S1 (~p, ~w):"
 1267:                  "~n   S1 info: ~p"
 1268:                  "~n   S2 info: ~p",
 1269:                  [I, S1Addr, S1Port, inet:info(S1), inet:info(S2)]),
 1270:               case gen_udp:send(S2, S1Addr, S1Port, Msg) of
 1271:                   ok ->
 1272:                       ok;
 1273:                   {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 1274:                       ?P("Failed sending message ~w: "
 1275:                          "~n   ~p", [N, Reason]),
 1276:                       exit(ERROR)
 1277:               end,
 1278:               ?P("expect message on S1"),
 1279:               receive
 1280:                   {udp, S1, _, S2Port, Msg} ->
 1281:                       ?P("expected message received on S1 - "
 1282:                          "send message back: from S1 to S2 (~p, ~w): "
 1283:                          "~n   ~p", [S2Addr, S2Port, inet:info(S1)]),
 1284:                       ok = gen_udp:send(S1, S2Addr, S2Port, Msg)
 1285:               after
 1286:                   5000 ->
 1287:                       ?P("ERROR: received nothing (->S1)"),
 1288:                       exit({error,timeout})
 1289:               end,
 1290:               ?P("expect message on S2"),
 1291:               receive
 1292:                   {udp, S2, _, S1Port, Msg} ->
 1293:                       ?P("expected message received on S2: "
 1294:                          "~n   ~p", [inet:info(S2)]),
 1295:                       ok
 1296:               after
 1297:                   5000 ->
 1298:                       ?P("ERROR: received nothing (->S2)"),
 1299:                       exit({error,timeout})
 1300:               end
 1301:       end, lists:seq(1,N)),
 1302:     ?P("expect passive message for socket (1)"),
 1303:     receive
 1304:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1305:             ?P("received passive message for socket (1) - "
 1306:                "verify socket active passive (false)"),
 1307:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active]))
 1308:     after
 1309:         5000 ->
 1310:             ?P("ERROR: received nothing (1)"),
 1311:             exit({error,udp_passive})
 1312:     end,
 1313:     ?P("expect passive message for socket (2)"),
 1314:     receive
 1315:         {udp_passive,S2} ->
 1316:             ?P("received passive message for socket (2) - "
 1317:                "verify socket active passive (false)"),
 1318:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S2, [active]))
 1319:     after
 1320:         5000 ->
 1321:             ?P("ERROR: received nothing (2)"),
 1322:             exit({error,udp_passive})
 1323:     end,
 1324: 
 1325:     ?P("create socket (3) with active = ~w and expect passive message", [0]),
 1326:     S3 = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,0}])),
 1327:     receive
 1328:         {udp_passive,S3} ->
 1329:             ?P("received passive message for socket (3) - "
 1330:                "verify socket active passive (false)"),
 1331:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S3, [active]))
 1332:     after
 1333:         5000 ->
 1334:             ?P("ERROR: received nothing (3)"),
 1335:             exit({error,udp_passive})
 1336:     end,
 1337: 
 1338:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1339:     ok = gen_udp:close(S3),
 1340:     ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 1341:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 1342: 
 1343:     ?P("done"),
 1344:     ok.
 1345: 
 1346: 
 1347: 
 1348: recvtos(Config) ->
 1349:     test_recv_opts(
 1350:       Config,
 1351:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96}], false,
 1352:       fun recvtos_ok/2).
 1353: 
 1354: recvtosttl(Config) ->
 1355:     test_recv_opts(
 1356:       Config,
 1357:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96},{recvttl,ttl,33}], false,
 1358:       fun (OSType, OSVer) ->
 1359:               recvtos_ok(OSType, OSVer) andalso recvttl_ok(OSType, OSVer)
 1360:       end).
 1361: 
 1362: recvttl(Config) ->
 1363:     test_recv_opts(
 1364:       Config,
 1365:       inet, [{recvttl,ttl,33}], false,
 1366:       fun recvttl_ok/2).
 1367: 
 1368: recvtclass(Config) ->
 1369:     {ok,IFs} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 1370:     case
 1371:         [Name ||
 1372:             {Name,Opts} <- IFs,
 1373:             lists:member({addr,{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}}, Opts)]
 1374:     of
 1375:         [_] ->
 1376:             test_recv_opts(
 1377:               Config,
 1378:               inet6, [{recvtclass,tclass,224}], false,
 1379:               fun recvtclass_ok/2);
 1380:         [] ->
 1381:             {skip,ipv6_not_supported,IFs}
 1382:     end.
 1383: 
 1384: 
 1385: sendtos(Config) ->
 1386:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_sendtos(Config) end).
 1387: 
 1388: do_sendtos(Config) ->
 1389:     test_recv_opts(
 1390:       Config,
 1391:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96}], true,
 1392:       fun sendtos_ok/2).
 1393: 
 1394: sendtosttl(Config) ->
 1395:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_sendtosttl(Config) end).
 1396: 
 1397: do_sendtosttl(Config) ->
 1398:     test_recv_opts(
 1399:       Config,
 1400:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96},{recvttl,ttl,33}], true,
 1401:       fun (OSType, OSVer) ->
 1402:               sendtos_ok(OSType, OSVer) andalso sendttl_ok(OSType, OSVer)
 1403:       end).
 1404: 
 1405: sendttl(Config) ->
 1406:     ?TC_TRY(sendttl, fun() -> do_sendttl(Config) end).
 1407: 
 1408: do_sendttl(Config) ->
 1409:     test_recv_opts(
 1410:       Config,
 1411:       inet, [{recvttl,ttl,33}], true,
 1412:       fun sendttl_ok/2).
 1413: 
 1414: sendtclass(Config) ->
 1415:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_sendtclass(Config) end).
 1416: 
 1417: do_sendtclass(Config) ->
 1418:     {ok,IFs} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 1419:     case
 1420:         [Name ||
 1421:             {Name,Opts} <- IFs,
 1422:             lists:member({addr,{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}}, Opts)]
 1423:     of
 1424:         [_] ->
 1425:             test_recv_opts(
 1426:               Config,
 1427:               inet6, [{recvtclass,tclass,224}], true,
 1428:               fun sendtclass_ok/2);
 1429:         [] ->
 1430:             {skip, {ipv6_not_supported, IFs}}
 1431:     end.
 1432: 
 1433: 
 1434: %% These version numbers are just above the highest noted in daily tests
 1435: %% where the test fails for a plausible reason, that is the lowest
 1436: %% where we can expect that the test might succeed, so
 1437: %% skip on platforms lower than this.
 1438: %%
 1439: %% On newer versions it might be fixed, but we'll see about that
 1440: %% when machines with newer versions gets installed...
 1441: %% If the test still fails for a plausible reason these
 1442: %% version numbers simply should be increased.
 1443: %% Or maybe we should change to only test on known good platforms?
 1444: 
 1445: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1446: recvtos_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {17,6,0});
 1447: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1448: recvtos_ok({unix,openbsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {6,9,0});
 1449: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1450: recvtos_ok({unix,netbsd}, _OSVer) -> false;
 1451: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1452: recvtos_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1453: %%
 1454: recvtos_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1455: recvtos_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1456: 
 1457: %% Option has no effect
 1458: recvttl_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1459: %%
 1460: recvttl_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1461: recvttl_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1462: 
 1463: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1464: recvtclass_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {9,9,0});
 1465: recvtclass_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {2,6,11});
 1466: %% Option has no effect
 1467: recvtclass_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1468: %%
 1469: recvtclass_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1470: recvtclass_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1471: 
 1472: 
 1473: %% To send ancillary data seems to require much higher version numbers
 1474: %% than receiving it...
 1475: %%
 1476: 
 1477: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1478: sendtos_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {19,0,0});
 1479: sendtos_ok({unix,netbsd}, _OSVer) -> false;
 1480: sendtos_ok({unix,openbsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {6,9,0});
 1481: sendtos_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1482: sendtos_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {4,0,0});
 1483: sendtos_ok({unix,freebsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {13,1,0});
 1484: %%
 1485: sendtos_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1486: sendtos_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1487: 
 1488: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1489: sendttl_ok({unix,darwin}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {19,6,0});
 1490: sendttl_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {4,0,0});
 1491: %% Using the option returns enoprotoopt, so it is not implemented.
 1492: sendttl_ok({unix,freebsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {13,1,0});
 1493: %% Option has no effect
 1494: sendttl_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1495: sendttl_ok({unix,openbsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {6,9,0});
 1496: %%
 1497: sendttl_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1498: sendttl_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1499: 
 1500: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1501: sendtclass_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {9,9,0});
 1502: sendtclass_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {2,6,11});
 1503: %% Option has no effect
 1504: sendtclass_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1505: %%
 1506: sendtclass_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1507: sendtclass_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1508: 
 1509: 
 1510: semver_lt({X1,Y1,Z1} = V1, {X2,Y2,Z2} = V2) ->
 1511:     ?P("semver_lt -> OS version check:"
 1512:        "~n   Version 1: ~p"
 1513:        "~n   Version 2: ~p", [V1, V2]),
 1514:     if
 1515:         X1 > X2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> X1 > X2: ~p > ~p", [X1, X2]), false;
 1516:         X1 < X2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> X1 < X2: ~p < ~p", [X1, X2]), true;
 1517:         Y1 > Y2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Y1 > Y2: ~p > ~p", [Y1, Y2]), false;
 1518:         Y1 < Y2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Y1 < Y2: ~p < ~p", [Y1, Y2]), true;
 1519:         Z1 > Z2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Z1 > Z2: ~p > ~p", [Z1, Z2]), false;
 1520:         Z1 < Z2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Z1 < Z2: ~p < ~p", [Z1, Z2]), true;
 1521:         true    -> ?P("semver_lt -> default"), false
 1522:     end;
 1523: semver_lt(V1, {_,_,_} = V2) ->
 1524:     ?P("semver_lt -> fallback OS version check when: "
 1525:        "~n   Version 1: ~p"
 1526:        "~n   Version 2: ~p", [V1, V2]),
 1527:     false.
 1528: 
 1529: test_recv_opts(Config, Family, Spec, TestSend, OSFilter) ->
 1530:     OSType = os:type(),
 1531:     OSVer  = os:version(),
 1532:     case OSFilter(OSType, OSVer) of
 1533:         true ->
 1534:             ?P("OS: ~p, ~p", [OSType, OSVer]),
 1535:             test_recv_opts(Config,
 1536:                            Family, Spec, TestSend, OSType, OSVer);
 1537:         false ->
 1538:             {skip,{not_supported_for_os_version,{OSType,OSVer}}}
 1539:     end.
 1540: %%
 1541: test_recv_opts(Config, Family, Spec, TestSend, _OSType, _OSVer) ->
 1542:     Timeout = 5000,
 1543:     RecvOpts = [RecvOpt || {RecvOpt,_,_} <- Spec],
 1544:     TrueRecvOpts = [{RecvOpt,true} || {RecvOpt,_,_} <- Spec],
 1545:     FalseRecvOpts = [{RecvOpt,false} || {RecvOpt,_,_} <- Spec],
 1546:     Opts = [Opt || {_,Opt,_} <- Spec],
 1547:     OptsVals = [{Opt,Val} || {_,Opt,Val} <- Spec],
 1548:     TrueRecvOpts_OptsVals = TrueRecvOpts ++ OptsVals,
 1549:     Addr =
 1550:         case Family of
 1551:             inet ->
 1552:                 {127,0,0,1};
 1553:             inet6 ->
 1554:                 {0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}
 1555:         end,
 1556:     %%
 1557:     ?P("try open socket (1) with true opts"),
 1558:     {ok, S1} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [Family, binary, {active,false}|TrueRecvOpts]),
 1559:     {ok, P1} = inet:port(S1),
 1560:     ?P("try get (true) socket (1) opts"),
 1561:     {ok, TrueRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts),
 1562:     ?P("try set (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1563:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, FalseRecvOpts),
 1564:     ?P("verify (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1565:     {ok, FalseRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts),
 1566:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, TrueRecvOpts_OptsVals),
 1567:     {ok,TrueRecvOpts_OptsVals} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts ++ Opts),
 1568:     %%
 1569:     %% S1 now has true receive options and set option values
 1570:     %%
 1571:     ?P("try open socket (2) with false opts"),
 1572:     {ok, S2} =
 1573:         ?OPEN(Config, 0, [Family, binary, {active,true} | FalseRecvOpts]),
 1574:     {ok, P2} = inet:port(S2),
 1575:     ?P("try get (false) socket (2) opts"),
 1576:     {ok, FalseRecvOpts_OptsVals2} = inet:getopts(S2, RecvOpts ++ Opts),
 1577:     OptsVals2 = FalseRecvOpts_OptsVals2 -- FalseRecvOpts,
 1578:     ?P("info: "
 1579:        "~n   Socket 1:    ~p"
 1580:        "~n   Socket 2:    ~p"
 1581:        "~n   Opts Vals 2: ~p", [inet:info(S1), inet:info(S2), OptsVals2]),
 1582: 
 1583:     %%
 1584:     %% S2 now has false receive options and default option values,
 1585:     %% OptsVals2 contains the default option values
 1586:     %%
 1587:     ?P("send/3: S2 -> S1"),
 1588:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, {Addr,P1}, <<"abcde">>),
 1589:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1590: 
 1591:     ?P("send/4: S1 -> S2"),
 1592:     ok = gen_udp:send(S1, Addr, P2, <<"fghij">>),
 1593:     TestSend andalso
 1594:         begin
 1595:             ?P("send/5: S2 -> S1"
 1596:                "~n   ~p", [OptsVals]),
 1597:             case gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, OptsVals, <<"ABCDE">>) of
 1598:                 ok ->
 1599:                     ?SLEEP(100),
 1600:                     ok;
 1601:                 {error, enoprotoopt = Reason1} ->
 1602:                     ?SKIPT(?F("send (1) failed: ~p", [Reason1]))
 1603:             end,
 1604:             ?P("send/4: S2 -> S1"
 1605:                "~n   ~p", [OptsVals]),
 1606:             case gen_udp:send(S2, {Addr,P1}, OptsVals, <<"12345">>) of
 1607:                 ok ->
 1608:                     ?SLEEP(100),
 1609:                     ok;
 1610:                 {error, enoprotoopt = Reason2} ->
 1611:                     ?SKIPT(?F("send (2) failed: ~p", [Reason2]))
 1612:             end
 1613:         end,
 1614:     ?P("try S1 recv"),
 1615:     {ok,{_,P2,OptsVals3, <<"abcde">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1616:     ?P("S1 recv: "
 1617:        "~n   OptsVals3: ~p", [OptsVals3]),
 1618:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1619: 
 1620:     verify_sets_eq(OptsVals3, OptsVals2),
 1621:     TestSend andalso
 1622:         begin
 1623:             ?P("try S1 recv"),
 1624:             {ok,{_,P2,OptsVals0,<<"ABCDE">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1625:             ?P("S1 recv: "
 1626:                "~n   OptsVals0: ~p", [OptsVals0]),
 1627:             ?SLEEP(100),
 1628: 
 1629:             ?P("try S1 recv"),
 1630:             {ok,{_,P2,OptsVals1,<<"12345">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1631:             ?P("S1 recv: "
 1632:                "~n   OptsVals1: ~p", [OptsVals1]),
 1633:             ?SLEEP(100),
 1634:             verify_sets_eq(OptsVals0, OptsVals),
 1635:             verify_sets_eq(OptsVals1, OptsVals)
 1636:         end,
 1637:     ?P("await message on S2"),
 1638:     receive
 1639:         {udp, S2, _, P1, <<"fghij">>} ->
 1640:             ?P("S2 received message"),
 1641:             ok;
 1642:         Other1 ->
 1643:             exit({unexpected,Other1})
 1644:     after Timeout ->
 1645:             exit(timeout)
 1646:     end,
 1647:     %%
 1648:     ?P("try set (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1649:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, FalseRecvOpts),
 1650:     ?P("verify (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1651:     {ok, FalseRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts),
 1652:     ?P("try set (true) socket (1) opts"),
 1653:     ok = inet:setopts(S2, TrueRecvOpts),
 1654:     ?P("verify (true) socket (1) opts"),
 1655:     {ok,TrueRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S2, RecvOpts),
 1656:     %%
 1657:     %% S1 now has false receive options and set option values
 1658:     %%
 1659:     %% S2 now has true receive options and default option values
 1660:     %%
 1661:     ?P("send/4: S2 -> S1"),
 1662:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, {Addr,P1}, [], <<"klmno">>),
 1663:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1664: 
 1665:     ?P("send/3: S1 -> S2"),
 1666:     ok = gen_udp:send(S1, {Family,{loopback,P2}}, <<"pqrst">>),
 1667:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1668: 
 1669:     TestSend andalso
 1670:         begin
 1671:             ?P("send/4: S1 -> S2"
 1672:                "~n   ~p", [OptsVals]),
 1673:             ok = gen_udp:send(S1,
 1674:                               {Family,{loopback,P2}}, OptsVals2, <<"PQRST">>),
 1675:             ?SLEEP(100)
 1676:         end,
 1677: 
 1678:     ?P("try recv data on S1"),
 1679:     {ok,{_,P2,<<"klmno">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1680:     ?P("await message on S2"),
 1681:     receive
 1682:         {udp,S2,_,P1,OptsVals4,<<"pqrst">>} ->
 1683:             ?P("S2 message received: "
 1684:                "~n   OptsVals4: ~p", [OptsVals4]),
 1685:             verify_sets_eq(OptsVals4, OptsVals);
 1686:         Other2 ->
 1687:             exit({unexpected,Other2})
 1688:     after Timeout ->
 1689:             exit(timeout)
 1690:     end,
 1691:     ?P("(maybe, ~p) await message on S2", [TestSend]),
 1692:     TestSend andalso
 1693:         receive
 1694:             {udp, S2, _, P1, OptsVals5, <<"PQRST">>} ->
 1695:                 ?P("S2 message received: "
 1696:                    "~n   OptsVals5: ~p", [OptsVals5]),
 1697:                 verify_sets_eq(OptsVals5, OptsVals2);
 1698:             Other3 ->
 1699:                 exit({unexpected,Other3})
 1700:         after Timeout ->
 1701:                 exit(timeout)
 1702:         end,
 1703: 
 1704:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1705:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 1706:     ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 1707: %%%    exit({{_OSType,_OSVer},success}), % In search for the truth
 1708: 
 1709:     ?P("done"),
 1710:     ok.
 1711: 
 1712: verify_sets_eq(L1, L2) ->
 1713:     L = lists:sort(L1),
 1714:     case lists:sort(L2) of
 1715:         L ->
 1716:             ok;
 1717:         _ ->
 1718:             exit({sets_neq, L1, L2})
 1719:     end.
 1720: 
 1721: 
 1722: local_basic(Config) ->
 1723:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_basic(Config, []) end).
 1724: 
 1725: local_basic_binary(Config) ->
 1726:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_basic(Config, [binary]) end).
 1727: 
 1728: do_local_basic(Config, Opts) ->
 1729:     ?P("begin"),
 1730:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1731:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1732:     CFile = local_filename(client),
 1733:     CAddr = {local,bin_filename(CFile)},
 1734:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1735:     _ = file:delete(CFile),
 1736:     %%
 1737:     ?P("create server socket"),
 1738:     S = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,SFile}},{active,false}|Opts])),
 1739:     ?P("create client socket"),
 1740:     C = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,CFile}},{active,false}|Opts])),
 1741:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1742:     CAddr = ok(inet:sockname(C)),
 1743:     ?P("SockName(s):"
 1744:        "~n   Server: ~p"
 1745:        "~n   Client: ~p", [SAddr, CAddr]),
 1746:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr),
 1747: 
 1748:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1749:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1750:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1751:     %%
 1752:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1753:     ok = file:delete(CFile),
 1754:     ?P("end"),
 1755:     ok.
 1756: 
 1757: local_unbound(Config) ->
 1758:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1759:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1760:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1761:     %%
 1762:     S = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,SAddr},{active,false}])),
 1763:     C = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [local,{active,false}])),
 1764:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1765:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, undefined),
 1766:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1767:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1768:     %%
 1769:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1770:     ok.
 1771: 
 1772: local_fdopen(Config) ->
 1773:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_fdopen(Config) end).
 1774: 
 1775: 
 1776: do_local_fdopen(Config) ->
 1777:     ?P("begin"),
 1778:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1779:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1780:     CFile = local_filename(client),
 1781:     CAddr = {local,bin_filename(CFile)},
 1782:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1783:     _ = file:delete(CFile),
 1784: 
 1785:     %%
 1786:     ?P("try create \"dummy\" (server) socket"),
 1787:     {S0, FD} = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,SAddr},{active,false}]) of
 1788:                    {ok, Sock0} when is_port(Sock0) ->
 1789:                        ?P("(port) try extract FD"),
 1790:                        Fd = ok(prim_inet:getfd(Sock0)),
 1791:                        {Sock0, Fd};
 1792:                    {ok, Sock0} -> % socket
 1793:                        ?P("(socket) try extract FD"),
 1794:                        {ok, [{fd, Fd}]} =
 1795:                            gen_udp_socket:getopts(Sock0, [fd]),
 1796:                        {Sock0, Fd}
 1797:                end,
 1798:     ?P("try create (client) socket"),
 1799:     C  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,CFile}},{active,false}])),
 1800:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S0)),
 1801:     CAddr = ok(inet:sockname(C)),
 1802:     ?P("try create (server) socket using fd = ~w", [FD]),
 1803:     S  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{fd, FD}, local, {active,false}])),
 1804:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1805: 
 1806:     ?P("perform handshake"),
 1807:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr),
 1808: 
 1809:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1810:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1811:     ok = gen_udp:close(S0),
 1812:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1813:     %%
 1814:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1815:     ok = file:delete(CFile),
 1816:     ?P("done"),
 1817:     ok.
 1818: 
 1819: local_fdopen_unbound(Config) ->
 1820:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_fdopen_unbound(Config) end).
 1821: 
 1822: do_local_fdopen_unbound(Config) ->
 1823:     ?P("begin"),
 1824:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1825:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1826:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1827: 
 1828:     %%
 1829:     ?P("try create (server) socket"),
 1830:     S  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,SAddr},{active,false}])),
 1831:     ?P("try create \"dummy\" (client) socket"),
 1832:     {C0, FD} = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [local,{active,false}]) of
 1833:                    {ok, Sock0} when is_port(Sock0) ->
 1834:                        ?P("(port) try extract FD"),
 1835:                        Fd = ok(prim_inet:getfd(Sock0)),
 1836:                        {Sock0, Fd};
 1837:                    {ok, Sock0} -> % socket
 1838:                        ?P("(socket) try extract FD"),
 1839:                        {ok, [{fd, Fd}]} =
 1840:                            gen_udp_socket:getopts(Sock0, [fd]),
 1841:                        {Sock0, Fd}
 1842:                end,
 1843:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1844:     ?P("try create (client) socket using fd = ~w", [FD]),
 1845:     C  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{fd,Fd},local,{active,false}])),
 1846: 
 1847:     ?P("perform handshake"),
 1848:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, undefined),
 1849: 
 1850:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1851:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1852:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1853:     ok = gen_udp:close(C0),
 1854:     %%
 1855:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1856: 
 1857:     ?P("done"),
 1858:     ok.
 1859: 
 1860: local_abstract(Config) ->
 1861:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_abstract(Config) end).
 1862: 
 1863: do_local_abstract(Config) ->
 1864:     case os:type() of
 1865: 	{unix,linux} ->
 1866:             ?P("create server socket"),
 1867: 	    S = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,<<>>}},{active,false}])),
 1868:             ?P("create client socket"),
 1869: 	    C = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,<<>>}},{active,false}])),
 1870:             ?P("verify sockname(s)"),
 1871: 	    {local,_} = SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1872: 	    {local,_} = CAddr = ok(inet:sockname(C)),
 1873:             ?P("perform handshake"),
 1874: 	    local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr),
 1875:             ?P("cleanup"),
 1876: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1877: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1878:             ?P("done"),
 1879: 	    ok;
 1880: 	_ ->
 1881: 	    {skip, "AF_LOCAL Abstract Addresses only supported on Linux"}
 1882:     end.
 1883: 
 1884: 
 1885: local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr) ->
 1886:     SData = "9876543210",
 1887:     CData = "0123456789",
 1888:     ?P("try (client) send"),
 1889:     ok = gen_udp:send(C, SAddr, 0, CData),
 1890:     ?P("try (server) recv"),
 1891:     CData1 = local_handshake_data(C, CData),
 1892:     case ok(gen_tcp:recv(S, 112)) of
 1893: 	{{unspec,<<>>}, 0, CData1} when CAddr =:= undefined ->
 1894: 	    ok;
 1895: 	{{local,<<>>}, 0, CData1} when CAddr =:= undefined ->
 1896: 	    ok;
 1897: 	{CAddr, 0, CData1} when CAddr =/= undefined ->
 1898: 	    ok = gen_udp:send(S, CAddr, 0, SData),
 1899:             SData1 = local_handshake_data(S, SData),
 1900: 	    {SAddr, 0, SData1} = ok(gen_tcp:recv(C, 112)),
 1901: 	    ok
 1902: 
 1903:     end.
 1904: 
 1905: local_handshake_data(S, Data) when is_list(Data) ->
 1906:     case inet:getopts(S, [mode]) of
 1907:         {ok,[{mode,binary}]} ->
 1908:             list_to_binary(Data);
 1909:         {ok,[{mode,list}]} ->
 1910:             Data
 1911:     end.
 1912: 
 1913: 
 1914: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
 1915: %% Open a passive socket. Create a socket that reads from it.
 1916: %% Then close the socket.
 1917: recv_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1918:     ?P("begin"),
 1919:     {ok, Sock} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{active, false}]),
 1920:     RECV = fun() ->
 1921:                    ?P("try recv"),
 1922:                    Res = gen_udp:recv(Sock, 0),
 1923:                    ?P("recv res: ~p", [Res]),
 1924:                    exit(Res)
 1925:            end,
 1926:     ?P("spawn reader"),
 1927:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(RECV),
 1928:     receive
 1929:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, PreReason} ->
 1930:             %% Make sure id does not die for some other reason...
 1931:             ct:fail("Unexpected pre close from reader (~p): ~p",
 1932:                           [Pid, PreReason])
 1933:     after 5000 -> % Just in case...
 1934:             ok
 1935:     end,
 1936:     ?P("close socket"),
 1937:     ok = gen_udp:close(Sock),
 1938:     ?P("await reader termination"),
 1939:     receive
 1940:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, {error, closed}} ->
 1941:             ?P("expected reader termination result"),
 1942:             ok;
 1943:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, PostReason} ->
 1944:             ?P("unexpected reader termination: ~p", [PostReason]),
 1945:             ct:fail("Unexpected post close from reader (~p): ~p",
 1946:                           [Pid, PostReason])
 1947:     after 5000 ->
 1948:             ?P("unexpected reader termination timeout"),
 1949:             demonitor(MRef, [flush]),
 1950:             exit(Pid, kill),
 1951:             ct:fail("Reader (~p) termination timeout", [Pid])
 1952:     end,
 1953:     ?P("done"),
 1954:     ok.
 1955: 
 1956: 
 1957: 
 1958: 
 1959: %% Test that connect/3 has effect.
 1960: connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1961:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1962:             fun() -> do_connect(Config) end).
 1963: 
 1964: do_connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1965:     ?P("begin"),
 1966:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 1967:     ?P("try create first socket"),
 1968:     {ok, S1} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
 1969:     {ok, P1} = inet:port(S1),
 1970:     ?P("try create second socket"),
 1971:     {ok, S2} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
 1972:     ?P("try set second socket active: false: "
 1973:        "~n   ~p", [inet:info(S2)]),
 1974:     ok = inet:setopts(S2, [{active, false}]),
 1975:     ?P("try close first socket"),
 1976:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 1977: 
 1978:     %% Test if this helps...
 1979:     ?P("sleep some"),
 1980:     ct:sleep({seconds, 5}),
 1981: 
 1982:     case os:type() of
 1983: 	{win32, nt} ->
 1984: 	    ok;
 1985: 	_ ->
 1986: 	    ?P("try some doomed connect targets: ~p", [P1]),
 1987: 	    {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, "", ?CLOSED_PORT),
 1988: 	    {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, '', ?CLOSED_PORT),
 1989: 	    {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, ".", ?CLOSED_PORT),
 1990: 	    {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, '.', ?CLOSED_PORT),
 1991: 	    ok
 1992:     end,
 1993: 
 1994:     ?P("try connect second socket to: ~p, ~p", [Addr, P1]),
