 1995:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S2, Addr, P1),
 1996:     ?P("try send on second socket"),
 1997:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, <<16#deadbeef:32>>),
 1998:     ?P("try recv on second socket - expect failure when"
 1999:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [inet:info(S2)]),
 2000: 
 2001:     %% Need this for the error handling
 2002:     OS = which_os(),
 2003: 
 2004:     ok = inet:setopts(S2, [{debug, true}]),
 2005:     ok = case gen_udp:recv(S2, 0, 500) of
 2006: 	     {error, econnrefused = R} ->
 2007:                  ?P("expected failure: ~w", [R]),
 2008:                  ok;
 2009: 	     {error, econnreset   = R} ->
 2010:                  ?P("expected failure: ~w", [R]),
 2011:                  ok;
 2012:              {error, timeout      = R} when (OS =:= darwin) ->
 2013:                  ?P("expected failure (~w) on darwin => SKIP", [R]),
 2014:                  (catch gen_udp:close(S2)),
 2015:                  skip(R);
 2016: 	     Other -> 
 2017:                  ?P("UNEXPECTED failure: ~p:"
 2018:                     "~n   ~p", [Other, inet:info(S2)]),
 2019:                  (catch gen_udp:close(S2)),
 2020:                  Other
 2021: 	 end,
 2022: 
 2023:     ?P("cleanup"),
 2024:     (catch gen_udp:close(S2)),
 2025: 
 2026:     ?P("done"),
 2027:     ok.
 2028: 
 2029: 
 2030: 
 2031: reconnect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2032:     Cond = fun() -> is_not_windows() end,
 2033:     Pre  = fun() ->
 2034:                    Addr = {127, 0, 0, 1},
 2035:                    case open_port_0(Config,
 2036:                                     [{debug, true}]) of
 2037:                        {ok, {S, Port}} ->
 2038:                            ?P("[unix] Socket opened: "
 2039:                               "~n   Socket:      ~p"
 2040:                               "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2041:                               "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2042:                               "~n   PeerName:    ~s",
 2043:                               [S, inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2044:                            #{local_addr => Addr,
 2045:                              socket     => S,
 2046:                              port       => Port};
 2047:                        {error, Reason} ->
 2048:                            skip(?F("Failed open initial port: "
 2049:                                    "~p", [Reason]))
 2050:                    end
 2051:            end,
 2052:     TC   = fun(State) -> do_reconnect(State) end,
 2053:     Post = fun(#{socket := S}) -> ok = gen_udp:close(S) end,
 2054:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2055:             Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2056: 
 2057: do_reconnect(#{local_addr := Addr,
 2058:                socket     := S,
 2059:                port       := Port}) ->
 2060:     XtrnAddr = {8,8,8,8},
 2061:     DestPort = 53,
 2062:     %% Connect to a local destination
 2063:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S, Addr, DestPort),
 2064:     ?P("Socket connected: "
 2065:        "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2066:        "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2067:        "~n   PeerName:    ~s", [inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2068:     {ok, {Addr,      DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 2069:     {ok, {LocalAddr, Port}}     = inet:sockname(S),
 2070: 
 2071:     %% Reconnect to external destination
 2072:     ?P("try (re-)connect to (external): ~s", [atos({XtrnAddr, DestPort})]),
 2073:     case gen_udp:connect(S, XtrnAddr, DestPort) of
 2074:         ok ->
 2075:             ok;
 2076:         {error, Reason} ->
 2077:             ?P("Failed (re-)connect to external destination:"
 2078:                "~n   Extern Dest: ~s"
 2079:                "~n   Reason:      ~p", [atos({XtrnAddr, DestPort}), Reason]),
 2080:             ct:fail({extern_reconnect, Reason})
 2081:     end,
 2082:     ?P("Socket (re-)connected: "
 2083:        "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2084:        "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2085:        "~n   PeerName:    ~s", [inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2086:     {ok, {XtrnAddr,     DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 2087:     {ok, {RoutableAddr, Port}}     = inet:sockname(S),
 2088: 
 2089:     ?P("verify socket (routable) addr: ~p", [RoutableAddr]),
 2090:     %% We should have a non-loopback address here
 2091:     true = RoutableAddr =/= LocalAddr,
 2092: 
 2093:     %% Reconnect to local addr
 2094:     ?P("(re-)connect to local address: ~s", [atos({Addr, DestPort})]),
 2095:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S, Addr, DestPort),
 2096:     ?P("Socket (re-)connected: "
 2097:        "~n   socket info: ~p"
 2098:        "~n   SockName:    ~s"
 2099:        "~n   PeerName:    ~s", [inet:info(S), sn(S), pn(S)]),
 2100:     {ok, {Addr,      DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 2101:     {ok, {LocalAddr, Port}}     = inet:sockname(S),
 2102: 
 2103:     ?P("done"),
 2104:     ok.
 2105: 
 2106: pn(S) ->
 2107:     case inet:peername(S) of
 2108:         {ok, Addr} ->
 2109:             atos(Addr);
 2110:         {error, _} ->
 2111:             "undefined"
 2112:     end.
 2113: 
 2114: sn(S) ->
 2115:     case inet:sockname(S) of
 2116:         {ok, Addr} ->
 2117:             atos(Addr);
 2118:         {error, _} ->
 2119:             "undefined"
 2120:     end.
 2121: 
 2122: atos({A, P}) when is_tuple(A) andalso is_integer(P) ->
 2123:     ?F("~s:~w", [inet_parse:ntoa(A), P]).
 2124:             
 2125: %% For Linux to keep the port when we reconnect;
 2126: %% we need to first bind to a specific port.
 2127: %% If we bind to port 0 and get an ephemeral port
 2128: %% it apparently can change when we reconnect to a different
 2129: %% destination depending on routing and interfaces.
 2130: %%
 2131: %% I consider this a workaround for a Linux bug,
 2132: %% ironically in a test case that tests
 2133: %% a workaround for another Linux bug (related)...
 2134: %%
 2135: open_port_0(Config, Opts) ->
 2136:     open_port_0(Config, 0, Opts, 10).
 2137: %%
 2138: open_port_0(Config, Port, Opts, N) ->
 2139:     case ?OPEN(Config, Port, Opts) of
 2140:         {ok, S} ->
 2141:             if
 2142:                 Port =:= 0 ->
 2143:                     {ok, Port_1} = inet:port(S),
 2144:                     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 2145:                     %% Speculate that we can open a socket with that port
 2146:                     open_port_0(Config, Port_1, Opts, N);
 2147:                 true ->
 2148:                     ?P("Socket port: ~w", [Port]),
 2149:                     {ok, {S, Port}}
 2150:             end;
 2151:         {error, eaddrinuse} when Port =/= 0 ->
 2152:             open_port_0(Config, 0, Opts, N - 1);
 2153:         {error, _} = Error ->
 2154:             Error
 2155:     end.
 2156: 
 2157: 
 2158: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2159: 
 2160: implicit_inet6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2161:     ?TC_TRY(implicit_inet6, fun() -> do_implicit_inet6(Config) end).
 2162: 
 2163: do_implicit_inet6(Config) ->
 2164:     Host = ok(inet:gethostname()),
 2165:     case inet:getaddr(Host, inet6) of
 2166: 	{ok, {16#fe80,0,0,0,_,_,_,_} = Addr} ->
 2167: 	     ?SKIPT("Got link local IPv6 address: "
 2168:                     ++inet:ntoa(Addr));
 2169: 	{ok, Addr} ->
 2170: 	    implicit_inet6(Config, Host, Addr);
 2171: 	{error, Reason} ->
 2172: 	    ?SKIPT("Can not look up IPv6 address: "
 2173:                    ++atom_to_list(Reason))
 2174:     end.
 2175: 
 2176: implicit_inet6(Config, Host, Addr) ->
 2177:     Active   = {active,false},
 2178:     Loopback = {0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1},
 2179:     ?P("try 1 with explicit inet6 on loopback"),
 2180:     S1 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [inet6, Active, {ip, Loopback}]) of
 2181:              {ok, Sock1} ->
 2182:                  Sock1;
 2183:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason1} ->
 2184:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason1));
 2185:              _ ->
 2186:                  ?SKIPT("IPv6 not supported")
 2187:          end,
 2188:     implicit_inet6(Config, S1, Active, Loopback),
 2189:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 2190: 
 2191:     %%
 2192:     Localaddr = ok(get_localaddr()),
 2193:     ?P("try 2 on local addr (~p)", [Localaddr]),
 2194:     S2 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Localaddr}, Active]) of
 2195:              {ok, Sock2} ->
 2196:                  Sock2;
 2197:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason2} ->
 2198:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason2))
 2199:          end,
 2200:     implicit_inet6(Config, S2, Active, Localaddr),
 2201:     ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 2202: 
 2203:     %%
 2204:     ?P("try 3 on addr ~p (~p)", [Addr, Host]),
 2205:     S3 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr, Addr}, Active]) of
 2206:              {ok, Sock3} ->
 2207:                  Sock3;
 2208:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason3} ->
 2209:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason3))
 2210:          end,
 2211:     implicit_inet6(Config, S3, Active, Addr),
 2212:     ok = gen_udp:close(S3),
 2213:     ok.
 2214: 
 2215: implicit_inet6(Config, S1, Active, Addr) ->
 2216:     ?P("get (\"local\") port number"),
 2217:     P1 = ok(inet:port(S1)),
 2218:     ?P("open \"remote\" socket"),
 2219:     S2 = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [inet6, Active]) of
 2220:              {ok, Sock2} ->
 2221:                  Sock2;
 2222:              {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason3} ->
 2223:                  ?SKIPT(open_failed_str(Reason3))
 2224:          end,
 2225:     ?P("get (\"remote\") port number"),
 2226:     P2 = ok(inet:port(S2)),
 2227:     ?P("connect (\"remote\") socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2228:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S2, Addr, P1),
 2229:     ?P("connect (\"local\") socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2230:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S1, Addr, P2),
 2231:     ?P("peername of \"local\" socket"),
 2232:     {Addr,P2} = ok(inet:peername(S1)),
 2233:     ?P("peername of \"remote\" socket"),
 2234:     {Addr,P1} = ok(inet:peername(S2)),
 2235:     ?P("sockname of \"local\" socket"),
 2236:     {Addr,P1} = ok(inet:sockname(S1)),
 2237:     ?P("sockname of \"remote\" socket"),
 2238:     {Addr,P2} = ok(inet:sockname(S2)),
 2239:     ?P("send ping on \"local\" socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2240:     %% On some platforms its allowed to specify address and port
 2241:     %% (that is; when useing sendto) *even* if the socket is connected
 2242:     %% (assuming the send destination is the same as connected destination).
 2243:     %% But on other platforms, e.g. FreeBSD, this is *not* allowed!
 2244:     %% Linux:
 2245:     %%   EISCONN
 2246:     %%      The connection-mode socket was connected already but a recipient
 2247:     %%      was specified. (Now either this error is returned, or the re-
 2248:     %%      cipient specification is ignored.)
 2249:     %% FreeBSD:
 2250:     %%   [EISCONN]    A destination address was specified and the socket is
 2251:     %%                already connected.
 2252:     case gen_udp:send(S1, Addr, P2, "ping") of
 2253:         ok ->
 2254:             ?P("recv ping on \"remote\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2255:             {Addr,P1,"ping"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S2, 1024, 1000)),
 2256:             ?P("send pong on \"remote\" socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2257:             ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, "pong"),
 2258:             ?P("recv ping on \"local\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2259:             {Addr,P2,"pong"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S1, 1024)),
 2260:             ?P("close \"remote\" socket"),
 2261:             ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 2262:             ok;
 2263:         {error, eisconn} ->
 2264:             ?P("socket is connect => *not* allowed to use sendto"),
 2265:             ok = gen_udp:send(S1, "ping"),
 2266:             %% Not allowed to specify address *at all* for a connected socket
 2267:             ?P("recv ping on \"remote\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2268:             {Addr,P1,"ping"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S2, 1024, 1000)),
 2269:             ?P("send pong on \"remote\" socket (to ~p:~p)", [Addr, P1]),
 2270:             ok = gen_udp:send(S2, "pong"),
 2271:             ?P("recv ping on \"local\" socket (from ~p:~p)", [Addr, P2]),
 2272:             {Addr,P2,"pong"} = ok(gen_udp:recv(S1, 1024)),
 2273:             ?P("close \"remote\" socket"),
 2274:             ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 2275:             ok
 2276:     end.
 2277: 
 2278: 
 2279: 
 2280: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2281: 
 2282: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2283: %% We create a socket, then spawns processes that create
 2284: %% monitors to it...
 2285: socket_monitor1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2286:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2287:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1,
 2288:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1(Config) end).
 2289: 
 2290: do_socket_monitor1(Config) ->
 2291:     ?P("begin"),
 2292:     Self         = self(),
 2293:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2294:     {ok, Sock1} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2295:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2296:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 2297: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 2298: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2299: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2300: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2301: 	 end,
 2302:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2303:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1),
 2304:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2305:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2306:     ?P("close socket"),
 2307:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2308:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2309:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2310:     ?P("done"),
 2311:     ok.
 2312: 
 2313: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 2314:     sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 2315: 
 2316: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 2317:     receive
 2318: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 2319: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 2320: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 2321: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 2322: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 2323: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 2324: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 2325: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 2326: 	    exit(ok);
 2327: 
 2328: 	Any ->
 2329: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 2330: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 2331: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 2332:     end.
 2333: 
 2334: sm_await_client_ready(Pid) ->
 2335:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid, "client").
 2336: 
 2337: sm_await_client_ready(Pid, Name) ->
 2338:     receive
 2339: 	{Pid, ready} ->
 2340: 	    ?P("received ~s ready", [Name])
 2341:     end.
 2342: 
 2343: sm_await_down(Pid, Mon, ExpRes) ->
 2344:     receive
 2345: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, ExpRes} ->
 2346: 	    ?P("received expected process down message from ~p", [Pid]),
 2347: 	    ok;
 2348: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, UnexpRes} ->
 2349: 	    ?P("received unexpected process down message from ~p: "
 2350: 	       "~n   ~p", [Pid, UnexpRes]),
 2351: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_down, UnexpRes})
 2352:     end.
 2353: 
 2354: 
 2355: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2356: 
 2357: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2358: %% We create "many" socket(s), then spawn processes that create
 2359: %% monitors to them...
 2360: socket_monitor1_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2361:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2362:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1_manys,
 2363:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config) end).
 2364: 
 2365: do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config) ->
 2366:     ?P("begin"),
 2367:     Self         = self(),
 2368:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2369:     ?P("[client] create socket(s)"),
 2370:     {ok, Sock1} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2371:     {ok, Sock2} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2372:     {ok, Sock3} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2373:     {ok, Sock4} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2374:     {ok, Sock5} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2375:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2376:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2377: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 2378: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 2379: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 2380: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2381: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 2382: 	 end,
 2383:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2384:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F([Sock1, Sock2, Sock3, Sock4, Sock5], F1),
 2385:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2386:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2387:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 2388:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2389:     gen_udp:close(Sock2),
 2390:     gen_udp:close(Sock3),
 2391:     gen_udp:close(Sock4),
 2392:     gen_udp:close(Sock5),
 2393:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2394:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2395:     ?P("done"),
 2396:     ok.
 2397: 
 2398: 
 2399: sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType) ->
 2400:     sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType, "client").
 2401: 
 2402: sm_await_socket_down2([], _ExpType, Name) ->
 2403:     ?P("[~s] all sockets down", [Name]),
 2404:     exit(ok);
 2405: sm_await_socket_down2(Mons, ExpType, Name) when is_list(Mons) ->
 2406:     ?P("[~s] await socket down", [Name]),
 2407:     receive
 2408: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) ->
 2409: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 2410: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 2411: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 2412: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 2413: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 2414: 	    case lists:keysearch(Mon, 1, Mons) of
 2415: 		{value, {Mon, Sock}} ->
 2416: 		    Mons2 = lists:keydelete(Mon, 1, Mons),
 2417: 		    sm_await_socket_down2(Mons2, ExpType, Name);
 2418: 		{value, Value} ->
 2419: 		    ?P("[~s] Unexpected socket down: "
 2420: 		       "~n   Value: ~p", [Name, Value]),
 2421: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_monitor, Mon, Value});
 2422: 		false ->
 2423: 		    ct:fail({unknown_monitor, Mon})
 2424: 	    end
 2425:     end.
 2426: 
 2427: 
 2428: 
 2429: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2430: 
 2431: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2432: %% We create a socket, then spawn client process(es) that create
 2433: %% monitors to it...
 2434: socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2435:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2436:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1_manyc,
 2437:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) end).
 2438: 
 2439: do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) ->
 2440:     ?P("begin"),
 2441:     Self         = self(),
 2442:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2443:     {ok, Sock1}  = ?OPEN(Config),
 2444:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 2445: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 2446: 	 end,
 2447:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2448: 		 ?P("[~s] monitor socket", [Name]),
 2449: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2450: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2451: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2452: 	 end,
 2453:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 2454:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1, "client1"),
 2455:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(Sock1, F1, "client2"),
 2456:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(Sock1, F1, "client3"),
 2457:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(Sock1, F1, "client4"),
 2458:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(Sock1, F1, "client5"),
 2459:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 2460:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 2461:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 2462:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 2463:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 2464:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 2465:     ?P("close socket"),
 2466:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2467:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 2468:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2469:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 2470:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 2471:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 2472:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 2473:     ?P("done"),
 2474:     ok.
 2475: 
 2476: 
 2477: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2478: 
 2479: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2480: %% We create a socket, then spawns processes that create
 2481: %% monitors to it...
 2482: socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2483:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2484:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor1_demon_after,
 2485:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) end).
 2486: 
 2487: do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) ->
 2488:     ?P("begin"),
 2489:     Self         = self(),
 2490:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2491:     {ok, Sock1}  = ?OPEN(Config),
 2492:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2493:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 2494: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 2495: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2496: 		 ?P("[client] sleep some"),
 2497: 		 ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 2498: 		 ?P("[client] cancel (socket) monitor"),
 2499: 		 inet:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 2500: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 2501: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2502: 		 sm_await_no_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2503: 	 end,
 2504:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2505:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1),
 2506:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2507:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2508:     ?P("close socket"),
 2509:     gen_udp:close(Sock1),
 2510:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2511:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2512:     ?P("done"),
 2513:     ok.
 2514: 
 2515: 
 2516: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 2517:     sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 2518: 
 2519: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 2520:     receive
 2521: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 2522: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 2523: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 2524: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected (socket) down message: "
 2525: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 2526: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 2527: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 2528: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 2529: 	    exit({unexpected_down, Mon, Type, Sock, Info});
 2530: 
 2531: 	Any ->
 2532: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 2533: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 2534: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 2535: 
 2536:     after 1000 ->
 2537: 	    ?P("[~s] expected message timeout", [Name]),
 2538: 	    exit(ok)
 2539:     end.
 2540: 
 2541: 
 2542: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2543: 
 2544: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2545: %% Spawn a process that creates a socket, then spawns processes
 2546: %% that create monitors to it...
 2547: socket_monitor2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2548:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2549:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor2,
 2550:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor2(Config) end).
 2551: 
 2552: do_socket_monitor2(Config) ->
 2553:     ?P("begin"),
 2554:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2555:     Self         = self(),
 2556:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 2557: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2558: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket"),
 2559: 			      {ok, S} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2560: 			      ?P("[owner] send socket to ctrl"),
 2561: 			      Self ! {socket, S},
 2562: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 2563: 			      receive
 2564: 				  {Self, die} ->
 2565: 				      exit(normal)
 2566: 			      end
 2567: 		      end),
 2568:     Sock1 = receive
 2569:                 {socket, S} ->
 2570:                     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 2571:                     S;
 2572:                 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 2573:                     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 2574:                        "~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 2575:                     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 2576: 	     end,
 2577:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2578:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 2579: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 2580: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2581: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2582: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 2583: 	 end,
 2584:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2585:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1),
 2586:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2587:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2588:     ?P("kill owner"),
 2589:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 2590:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 2591:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 2592:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2593:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2594:     ?P("done"),
 2595:     ok.
 2596: 
 2597: 
 2598: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2599: 
 2600: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2601: %% Spawn a process that creates "many" socket(s), then spawns
 2602: %% a process that create monitors to them...
 2603: 
 2604: socket_monitor2_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2605:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2606:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor2_manys,
 2607:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config) end).
 2608: 
 2609: do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config) ->
 2610:     ?P("begin"),
 2611:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2612:     Self         = self(),
 2613:     ?P("spawn owner"),
 2614:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 2615: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2616: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket(s)"),
 2617: 			      {ok, S1} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2618: 			      {ok, S2} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2619: 			      {ok, S3} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2620: 			      {ok, S4} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2621: 			      {ok, S5} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2622: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket(s) to ctrl"),
 2623: 			      Self ! {socket, [S1, S2, S3, S4, S5]},
 2624: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 2625: 			      receive
 2626: 				  {Self, die} ->
 2627: 				      exit(normal)
 2628: 			      end
 2629: 		      end),
 2630:     ?P("await sockets (from owner)"),
 2631:     Socks = receive
 2632:                 {socket, Ss} ->
 2633:                     ?P("received socket(s) from owner"),
 2634:                     Ss;
 2635:                 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 2636:                     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 2637:                        "~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 2638:                     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 2639:             end,
 2640:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 2641:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2642: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 2643: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 2644: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 2645: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 2646: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2647: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 2648: 	 end,
 2649:     ?P("spawn client"),
 2650:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Socks, F1),
 2651:     ?P("await client ready"),
 2652:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 2653:     ?P("kill owner"),
 2654:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 2655:     ?P("await owner (~p) termination", [OwnerPid]),
 2656:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 2657:     ?P("await client termination"),
 2658:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2659:     ?P("done"),
 2660:     ok.
 2661: 
 2662: 
 2663: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2664: 
 2665: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2666: %% Spawn a process that creates a socket, then spawns (client)
 2667: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 2668: socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2669:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2670:     ?TC_TRY(socket_monitor2_manyc,
 2671:             fun() -> do_socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) end).
 2672: 
 2673: do_socket_monitor2_manyc(Config) ->
 2674:     ?P("begin"),
 2675:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 2676:     Self         = self(),
 2677:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 2678: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 2679: 			      {ok, S} = ?OPEN(Config),
 2680: 			      Self ! {socket, S},
 2681: 			      receive
 2682: 				  {Self, die} ->
 2683: 				      exit(normal)
 2684: 			      end
 2685: 		      end),
 2686:     Sock1 = receive
 2687: 		 {socket, S} ->
 2688: 		     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 2689: 		     S;
 2690: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 2691: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 2692: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 2693: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 2694: 	     end,
 2695:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 2696: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 2697: 	 end,
 2698:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 2699: 		 ?P("[~s] create monitor", [Name]),
 2700: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 2701: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 2702: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type, Name)
 2703: 	 end,
 2704:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 2705:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(Sock1, F1, "client1"),
 2706:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(Sock1, F1, "client2"),
 2707:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(Sock1, F1, "client3"),
 2708:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(Sock1, F1, "client4"),
 2709:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(Sock1, F1, "client5"),
 2710:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 2711:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 2712:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 2713:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 2714:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 2715:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 2716:     ?P("kill owner"),
 2717:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 2718:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 2719:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 2720:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 2721:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 2722:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 2723:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 2724:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 2725:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 2726:     ?P("done"),
 2727:     ok.
 2728: 
 2729: 
 2730: 
 2731: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2732: 
 2733: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2734: %% Spawn a process that creates a socket, then spawns (client)
 2735: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 2736: otp_17492(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2737:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2738:     ?TC_TRY(otp_17492, fun() -> do_otp_17492(Config) end).
 2739: 
 2740: do_otp_17492(Config) ->
 2741:     ?P("begin"),
 2742: 
 2743:     Self = self(),
 2744: 
 2745:     ?P("try create socket"),
 2746:     {ok, L} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, []),
 2747: 
 2748:     ?P("try get (created) socket info"),
 2749:     try inet:info(L) of
 2750: 	#{owner := Owner} = Info when is_pid(Owner) andalso (Owner =:= Self) ->
 2751: 	    ?P("(created) socket info: ~p", [Info]);
 2752: 	OBadInfo ->
 2753: 	    ?P("(created) socket info: ~p", [OBadInfo]),
 2754: 	    (catch gen_udp:close(L)),
 2755: 	    ct:fail({invalid_created_info, OBadInfo})
 2756:     catch
 2757: 	OC:OE:OS ->
 2758: 	    ?P("Failed get (created) Listen socket info: "
 2759: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 2760: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 2761: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 2762: 	    (catch gen_udp:close(L)),
 2763: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_created_info_result, {OC, OE, OS}})
 2764:     end,
 2765: 
 2766:     ?P("try close socket"),
 2767:     ok = gen_udp:close(L),
 2768: 
 2769:     ?P("try get (closed) socket info"),
 2770:     try inet:info(L) of
 2771: 	#{states := [closed]} = CInfo when is_port(L) ->
 2772: 	    ?P("(closed) socket info: "
 2773: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 2774: 	#{rstates := [closed], wstates := [closed]} = CInfo ->
 2775: 	    ?P("(closed) socket info: "
 2776: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 2777: 	CBadInfo ->
 2778: 	    ?P("(closed) socket info: ~p", [CBadInfo]),
 2779: 	    ct:fail({invalid_closed_info, CBadInfo})
 2780:     catch
 2781: 	CC:CE:CS ->
 2782: 	    ?P("Failed get (closed) socket info: "
 2783: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 2784: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 2785: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [CC, CE, CS]),
 2786: 	    (catch gen_udp:close(L)),
 2787: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_closed_info_result, {CC, CE, CS}})
 2788:     end,
 2789: 
 2790:     ?P("done"),
 2791:     ok.
 2792: 
 2793: 
 2794: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 2795: 
 2796: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 2797: 
 2798: %% Here we use socket:sockaddr_in6() when creating and using the
 2799: %% socket(s).
 2800: %%
 2801: t_simple_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2802:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2803:             fun() -> ?LIB:has_support_ipv6() end,
 2804:             fun() ->
 2805:                     Domain = inet6,
 2806:                     LocalAddr =
 2807:                         case ?LIB:which_local_addr(Domain) of
 2808:                             {ok, LA} ->
 2809:                                 LA;
 2810:                         {error, _} ->
 2811:                             skip("No local address")
 2812:                     end,
 2813:                     SockAddr = #{family   => Domain,
 2814:                                  addr     => LocalAddr,
 2815:                                  port     => 0},
 2816:                     do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config)
 2817:             end).
 2818: 
 2819: 
 2820: t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2821:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2822:             fun() ->
 2823:                     ?LIB:has_support_ipv6(),
 2824:                     is_net_supported(),
 2825:                     is_not_darwin()
 2826:             end,
 2827:             fun() ->
 2828:                     Domain = inet6,
 2829:                     LinkLocalAddr =
 2830:                         case ?LIB:which_link_local_addr(Domain) of
 2831:                             {ok, LLA} ->
 2832:                                 LLA;
 2833:                             {error, _} ->
 2834:                                 skip("No link local address")
 2835:                         end,
 2836:                     Filter =
 2837:                         fun(#{addr := #{family := D,
 2838:                                         addr   := A}} = C) ->
 2839:                                 if 
 2840:                                     (D =:= Domain) andalso
 2841:                                     (A =:= LinkLocalAddr) ->
 2842:                                         ?P("found link-local candidate: "
 2843:                                            "~n   ~p", [C]),
 2844:                                         true;
 2845:                                     true ->
 2846:                                         false
 2847:                                 end;
 2848:                            (_) ->
 2849:                                 false
 2850:                         end,
 2851:                     case net:getifaddrs(Filter) of
 2852:                         {ok, [#{addr := #{scope_id := ScopeID}}=H|T]} ->
 2853:                             ?P("found link-local candidate(s): "
 2854:                                "~n   Candidate:       ~p"
 2855:                                "~n   Rest Candidate:  ~p", [H, T]),
 2856:                             SockAddr = #{family   => Domain,
 2857:                                          addr     => LinkLocalAddr,
 2858:                                          port     => 0,
 2859:                                          scope_id => ScopeID},
 2860:                             do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config);
 2861:                         {ok, _} ->
 2862:                             skip("Scope ID not found");
 2863:                         {error, R} ->
 2864:                             skip({failed_getifaddrs, R})
 2865:                     end
 2866:             end).
 2867: 
 2868: t_simple_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2869:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 2870:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2871:             fun() -> ok end,
 2872:             fun() ->
 2873:                     Domain = inet,
 2874:                     LocalAddr =
 2875:                         case ?LIB:which_local_addr(Domain) of
 2876:                             {ok, LA} ->
 2877:                                 LA;
 2878:                         {error, _} ->
 2879:                             skip("No local address")
 2880:                     end,
 2881:                     SockAddr = #{family   => Domain,
 2882:                                  addr     => LocalAddr,
 2883:                                  port     => 0},
 2884:                     do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config)
 2885:             end).
 2886: 
 2887: t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2888:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 2889:             fun() -> ok end,
 2890:             fun() ->
 2891:                     Domain = inet,
 2892:                     LinkLocalAddr =
 2893:                         case ?LIB:which_link_local_addr(Domain) of
 2894:                             {ok, LLA} ->
 2895:                                 LLA;
 2896:                             {error, _} ->
 2897:                                 skip("No link local address")
 2898:                         end,
 2899:                     SockAddr = #{family => Domain,
 2900:                                  addr   => LinkLocalAddr,
 2901:                                  port   => 0},
 2902:                     do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(SockAddr, Config)
 2903:             end).
 2904: 
 2905: 
 2906: do_simple_sockaddr_send_recv(#{family := _Fam} = SockAddr, _) ->
 2907:     %% Create the server
 2908:     Self   = self(),
 2909:     ?P("~n      SockAddr: ~p", [SockAddr]),
 2910:     ServerF = fun() ->
 2911:                       ?P("[server] try create socket"),
 2912:                       Sock =
 2913:                           try gen_udp:open(0, [{ifaddr, SockAddr},
 2914:                                                {active, true},
 2915:                                                binary]) of
 2916:                               {ok, S} ->
 2917:                                   S;
 2918:                               {error, OReason} ->
 2919:                                   ?P("[server] open error: "
 2920:                                      "~n      Reason: ~p", [OReason]),
 2921:                                   exit({open_error, OReason})
 2922:                           catch
 2923:                               OC:OE:OS ->
 2924:                                   ?P("[server] open failure: "
 2925:                                      "~n      Error Class: ~p"
 2926:                                      "~n      Error:       ~p"
 2927:                                      "~n      Call Stack:  ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 2928:                                   exit({open_failure, {OC, OE, OS}})
 2929:                           end,
 2930:                       ?P("[server] try get port"),
 2931:                       {ok, Port}  = inet:port(Sock),
 2932:                       ?P("[server] port: ~w", [Port]),
 2933:                       Self ! {{port, Port}, self()},
 2934: 
 2935: 
 2936:                       %% --- message sequance 1 ---
 2937: 
 2938:                       ?P("[server] await message 1"),
 2939:                       {CIP, CPort} =
 2940:                           receive
 2941:                               {udp, Sock, CIP1, CPort1, <<"hej">>} ->
 2942:                                   ?P("[server] received expected message 1 - "
 2943:                                      "connect to *this* client"),
 2944:                                   ok = gen_udp:connect(Sock, CIP1, CPort1),
 2945:                                   ?P("[server] send reply"),
 2946:                                   case gen_udp:send(Sock, "hopp") of
 2947:                                       ok -> 
 2948:                                           {CIP1, CPort1};
 2949:                                       {error, ehostunreach = Reason1} ->
 2950:                                           ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2951:                                              [Reason1]),
 2952:                                           exit({skip, Reason1});
 2953:                                       {error, enetunreach = Reason1} ->
 2954:                                           ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2955:                                              [Reason1]),
 2956:                                           exit({skip, Reason1});
 2957:                                       {error, Reason1} ->
 2958:                                           exit({send_failed, Reason1})
 2959:                                   end
 2960:                           after 5000 ->
 2961:                                   ?P("[server] receive (1) timeout:"
 2962:                                      "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 2963:                                   exit(receive_timeout)
 2964:                           end,
 2965: 
 2966: 
 2967:                       %% --- message sequance 2 ---
 2968: 
 2969:                       ?P("[server] await message 2"),
 2970:                       receive
 2971:                           {udp, Sock, CIP2, CPort2, <<"hej">>}
 2972:                             when (CIP2 =:= CIP) andalso (CPort2 =:= CPort) ->
 2973:                               ?P("[server] received expected message 2 - "
 2974:                                  "send reply"),
 2975:                               case gen_udp:send(Sock, "hopp") of
 2976:                                   ok -> 
 2977:                                       ok;
 2978:                                   {error, ehostunreach = Reason2} ->
 2979:                                       ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2980:                                          [Reason2]),
 2981:                                       exit({skip, Reason2});
 2982:                                   {error, enetunreach = Reason2} ->
 2983:                                       ?P("[server] send failed: ~p",
 2984:                                          [Reason2]),
 2985:                                       exit({skip, Reason2});
 2986:                                   {error, Reason2} ->
 2987:                                       exit({send_failed, Reason2})
 2988:                               end
 2989:                       after 5000 ->
 2990:                               ?P("[server] receive (2) timeout:"
 2991:                                  "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 2992:                               exit(receive_timeout)
 2993:                       end,
 2994: 
 2995: 
 2996:                       %% --- message sequance 3 ---
 2997: 
 2998:                       ?P("[server] await message 3"),
 2999:                       receive
 3000:                           {udp, Sock, CIP3, CPort3, <<"hej">>}
 3001:                             when (CIP3 =:= CIP) andalso (CPort3 =:= CPort) ->
 3002:                               ?P("[server] received expected message 3 - "
 3003:                                  "send reply"),
 3004:                               ok = gen_udp:send(Sock, "hopp")
 3005:                       after 5000 ->
 3006:                               ?P("[server] receive (3) timeout:"
 3007:                                  "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3008:                               exit(receive_timeout)
 3009:                       end,
 3010: 
 3011: 
 3012:                       %% --- message sequance 4 ---
 3013: 
 3014:                       ?P("[server] await message 4 - should be none!"),
 3015:                       receive
 3016:                           {udp, Sock, CIP4, CPort4, <<"hej">>} ->
 3017:                               ?P("[server] received unexpected message 4:"
 3018:                                  "~n      Address: ~p"
 3019:                                  "~n      Port:    ~p", [CIP4, CPort4]),
 3020:                               exit({unexpected_message, CIP4, CPort4})
 3021:                       after
 3022:                           1000 ->
 3023:                               ?P("Received nothing - expected"),
 3024:                               Self ! {nothing, self()}
 3025:                       end,
 3026: 
 3027:                       ?P("[server] await termination command"),
 3028:                       receive
 3029:                           {die, Self} ->
 3030:                               ?P("[server] terminating"),
 3031:                               (catch gen_udp:close(Sock)),
 3032:                               exit(normal)
 3033:                       end
 3034:               end,
 3035:     ?P("try start server"),
 3036:     Server = spawn_link(ServerF),
 3037:     ?P("server started - await port "),
 3038:     ServerPort = receive
 3039:                      {{port, Port}, Server} ->
 3040:                          Port;
 3041:                      {'EXIT', Server, Reason} ->
 3042:                          ?P("server died unexpectedly: "
 3043:                             "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
 3044:                          exit({unexpected_server_failure, Reason})
 3045:                  end,
 3046:     ?P("server port received: ~p", [ServerPort]),
 3047:     
 3048:     ?P("try connect to server"),
 3049:     ServerSockAddr = SockAddr#{port => ServerPort},
 3050:     {ok, CSock1} = gen_udp:open(0,
 3051:                                 [{ifaddr, SockAddr},
 3052:                                  {active, true},
 3053:                                  binary]),
 3054:     {ok, CSock2} = gen_udp:open(0,
 3055:                                 [{ifaddr, SockAddr},
 3056:                                  {active, true},
 3057:                                  binary]),
 3058:     ?P("client socket: "
 3059:        "~n      CSock 1: ~p"
 3060:        "~n      CPort 1: ~p"
 3061:        "~n      CSock 2: ~p"
 3062:        "~n      CPort 2: ~p",
 3063:        [CSock1, inet:port(CSock1), CSock2, inet:port(CSock2)]),
 3064: 
 3065: 
 3066:     %% --- message sequance 1 ---
 3067: 
 3068:     ?P("[csock 1] try (trad = address and port) send message 1"),
 3069:     case gen_udp:send(CSock1, maps:get(addr, SockAddr), ServerPort, "hej") of
 3070:         ok ->
 3071:             ok;
 3072:         {error, ehostunreach = Reason1} ->
 3073:             ?SKIPT(?F("send (1,1) failed: ~p", [Reason1]));
 3074:         {error, Reason1} ->
 3075:             ct:fail({send_failed, Reason1})
 3076:     end,
 3077:                  
 3078: 
 3079:     ?P("[csock 1] await reply message 1"),
 3080:     receive
 3081:         {udp, CSock1, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3082:             ?P("[csock 1] received expected reply message 1"),
 3083:             ok;
 3084: 
 3085:         {'EXIT', Server, {skip, SReason1}} ->
 3086:             ?P("received unexpected server skip exit (1):"
 3087:                "~n      ~p", [SReason1]),
 3088:             ?SKIPT(?F("server send (1,1) failed: ~p", [SReason1]));
 3089: 
 3090:         {'EXIT', Server, SReason1} ->
 3091:             ?P("received unexpected server exit (1):"
 3092:                "~n      ~p", [SReason1]),
 3093:             ct:fail({unexpected_server_exit, 1, SReason1})
 3094: 
 3095:     after 5000 ->
 3096:             ?P("receive (1) timeout:"
 3097:                "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3098:             ct:fail(receive_timeout)
 3099:     end,
 3100: 
 3101: 
 3102:     %% --- message sequance 2 ---
 3103: 
 3104:     ?P("[csock 1] try (sockaddr) send message 2"),
 3105:     %% DstSockAddr = #{family => maps:get(family, SockAddr),
 3106:     %%                 addr   => maps:get(addr, SockAddr),
 3107:     %%                 port   => ServerPort},
 3108:     DstSockAddr = ServerSockAddr,
 3109:     case gen_udp:send(CSock1, DstSockAddr, "hej") of
 3110:         ok ->
 3111:             ok;
 3112:         {error, ehostunreach = Reason2} ->
 3113:             ?SKIPT(?F("send (1,2) failed: ~p", [Reason2]));
 3114:         {error, Reason2} ->
 3115:             ct:fail({send_failed, Reason2})
 3116:     end,
 3117:         
 3118: 
 3119:     ?P("[csock 1] await reply message 2"),
 3120:     receive
 3121:         {udp, CSock1, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3122:             ?P("[csock 1] received expected reply message 2"),
 3123:             ok;
 3124: 
 3125:         {'EXIT', Server, {skip, SReason2}} ->
 3126:             ?P("received unexpected server skip exit (2):"
 3127:                "~n      ~p", [SReason2]),
 3128:             ?SKIPT(?F("server send (1,2) failed: ~p", [SReason2]));
 3129: 
 3130:         {'EXIT', Server, SReason2} ->
 3131:             ?P("received unexpected server exit (2):"
 3132:                "~n.     ~p", [SReason2]),
 3133:             ct:fail({unexpected_server_exit, 2, SReason2})
 3134: 
 3135:     after 5000 ->
 3136:             ?P("[csock 1] receive (2) timeout:"
 3137:                "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3138:             ct:fail(receive_timeout)
 3139:     end,
 3140: 
 3141: 
 3142:     %% --- message sequance 3 ---
 3143: 
 3144:     ?P("[csock 1] try connect to: "
 3145:        "~n      ~p", [ServerSockAddr]),
 3146:     ok = gen_udp:connect(CSock1, DstSockAddr),
 3147: 
 3148:     ?P("[csock 1] try send message 3"),
 3149:     ok = gen_udp:send(CSock1, "hej"),
 3150: 
 3151:     ?P("[csock 1] await reply message 3"),
 3152:     receive
 3153:         {udp, CSock1, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3154:             ?P("received expected reply message 3"),
 3155:             ok;
 3156: 
 3157:         {'EXIT', Server, SReason3} ->
 3158:             ?P("received unexpected server exit (3):"
 3159:                "~n.     ~p", [SReason3]),
 3160:             ct:fail({unexpected_server_exit, 3, SReason3})
 3161: 
 3162:     after 5000 ->
 3163:             ?P("[csock 1] receive (2) timeout:"
 3164:                "~n      ~p", [mq()]),
 3165:             ct:fail(receive_timeout)
 3166: 
 3167:     end,
 3168: 
 3169: 
 3170:     %% --- message sequance 4 ---
 3171: 
 3172:     ?P("[csock 2] try (sockaddr) send message 4"),
 3173:     ok = gen_udp:send(CSock2, DstSockAddr, "hej"),
 3174: 
 3175:     ?P("[csock 2] await reply message 4 - expect failure"),
 3176:     receive
 3177:         {udp, CSock2, _, _, <<"hopp">>} ->
 3178:             ?P("[csock 2] received unexpected reply message 4"),
 3179:             exit(received_unexpected_message);
 3180:         {nothing, Server} ->
 3181:             ?P("[csock 2] server received nothing - expected"),
 3182:             ok
 3183:     end,
 3184: 
 3185: 
 3186:     ?P("terminate server"),
 3187:     Server ! {die, self()},
 3188: 
 3189:     ?P("await server termination"),
 3190:     receive
 3191:         {'EXIT', Server, normal} ->
 3192:             ok
 3193:     end,
 3194:     
 3195:     ?P("cleanup"),
 3196:     (catch gen_udp:close(CSock1)),
 3197:     (catch gen_udp:close(CSock2)),
 3198: 
 3199:     ?P("done"),
 3200:     ok.
 3201: 
 3202:     
 3203: 
 3204: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3205: 
 3206: %% Verify that the options [add|drop]_membership do not mess up
 3207: %% the options (including 'ip' which could not be added *after*).
 3208: %% This just attempts to very that the option processing is ok.
 3209: otp_18323_opts_processing(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3210:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3211:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_otp_18323_opts_processing(Config) end).
 3212: 
 3213: do_otp_18323_opts_processing(_Config) ->
 3214:     ?P("begin"),
 3215: 
 3216:     do_otp_18323_opts_processing_verify(
 3217:       {add_membership,  {{239,1,2,3},{0,0,0,0}}}),
 3218: 
 3219:     do_otp_18323_opts_processing_verify(
 3220:       {drop_membership, {{239,1,2,3},{0,0,0,0}}}),
 3221: 
 3222:     ?P("done"),
 3223:     ok.
 3224: 
 3225: do_otp_18323_opts_processing_verify(MembershipOpt) ->
 3226:     Port   = 4321,
 3227:     RecBuf = 123456,
 3228:     Active = 10,
 3229:     IP     = {1,2,3,4},
 3230:     Opts   = [binary, MembershipOpt, {ip, IP}, {active, Active}],
 3231: 
 3232:     case inet:udp_options([{port, Port}, {recbuf, RecBuf} | Opts], inet_udp) of
 3233:         {ok, #udp_opts{ifaddr = IP,
 3234:                        port   = Port,
 3235:                        opts   = SockOpts}} ->
 3236:             ?P("Processed Socket Options: "
 3237:                "~n   IfAddr:    ~p"
 3238:                "~n   Port:      ~p"
 3239:                "~n   Sock Opts: ~p", [IP, Port, SockOpts]),
 3240:             %% Check that the recbuf and mode options are as expected
 3241:             %% The option 'binary' is shorthand for {mode, binary}
 3242:             {value, {recbuf, RecBuf}} = lists:keysearch(recbuf, 1, SockOpts),
 3243:             {value, {mode,   binary}} = lists:keysearch(mode,   1, SockOpts),
 3244:             {value, {active, Active}} = lists:keysearch(active, 1, SockOpts),
 3245:             ok;
 3246:         {error, Reason} ->
 3247:             exit(?F("Failed processing options: ~p", [Reason]))
 3248:     end.
 3249: 
 3250: 
 3251: 
 3252: 
 3253: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3254: 
 3255: %% Verify that the options [add|drop]_membership do not mess up
 3256: %% the options (including 'ip' which could not be added *after*).
 3257: otp_18323_open(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3258:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3259:     Pre  = fun() ->
 3260:                    {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 3261:                    #{local_addr => Addr}
 3262:            end,
 3263:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_18323_open(State) end,
 3264:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3265:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Pre, Case, Post).
 3266: 
 3267: do_otp_18323_open(#{local_addr := Addr}) ->
 3268:     ?P("begin"),
 3269: 
 3270:     ROpts = [binary,
 3271:              {add_membership, {Addr,{0,0,0,0}}},
 3272:              {ip, Addr},
 3273:              {active,false},
 3274:              {debug, true}],
 3275:     SOpts = [{reuseaddr, true}, binary],
 3276: 
 3277:     ?P("create received socket"),
 3278:     {ok, R}     = gen_udp:open(0, ROpts),
 3279:     ?P("extract received socket port"),
 3280:     {ok, RPort} = inet:port(R),
 3281: 
 3282:     ?P("create sender socket"),
 3283:     {ok, S} = gen_udp:open(0, SOpts),
 3284: 
 3285:     ?P("send to receiver (at port ~w)", [RPort]),
 3286:     ok = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RPort, <<"aaaaa">>),
 3287: 
 3288:     ?P("attempt to receive data on specified format binary)"),
 3289:     {ok, {_,_,<<"aaaaa">>}} = gen_udp:recv(R, 0, 200),
 3290: 
 3291:     ?P("done"),
 3292:     ok.
 3293: 
 3294: 
 3295: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3296: 
 3297: %% On some linux platforms, mostly in "docker"-like environments,
 3298: %% send *can* block. This, I think, mostly depends the value of
 3299: %% system config *net.unix.max_dgram_qlen*. On Docker this can
 3300: %% be small (10). With "normal" machines this is much larger (> 500),
 3301: %% which makes this hard tp reproduce.
 3302: otp_19332(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3303:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3304:     Cond = fun() ->
 3305:                    is_linux(),
 3306:                    is_docker(Config),
 3307:                    %% We should really test for UDS support also,
 3308:                    %% but how without using 'socket'?
 3309:                    %% Maybe its enough to open the socket (with 'local').
 3310:                    has_small_enough_dgram_qlen(20),
 3311:                    ok
 3312:            end,
 3313:     Pre  = fun() ->
 3314:                    Opts = [local,
 3315:                            {active, false},
 3316:                            {debug, true}],
 3317:                    case gen_udp:open(0, Opts) of
 3318:                        {ok, Sock} ->
 3319:                            inet:setopts(Sock, [{debug, false}]),
 3320:                            #{sock => Sock};
 3321:                        {error, Reason} ->
 3322:                            skip(?F("Failed open socket: ~p", [Reason]))
 3323:                    end
 3324:            end,
 3325:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_19332(State) end,
 3326:     Post = fun(#{sock := Sock}) ->
 3327:                    (catch gen_udp:close(Sock))
 3328:            end,
 3329:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 3330: 
 3331: do_otp_19332(#{sock := Sock}) ->
 3332:     ?P("begin"),
 3333: 
 3334:     0 = do_otp_19332_test(Sock),
 3335: 
 3336:     ?P("done"),
 3337:     ok.
 3338: 
 3339: do_otp_19332_test(S) ->
 3340:     do_otp_19332_test(S, 100000, #{}, 0).
 3341: 
 3342: do_otp_19332_test(_S, 0, Errs, NumR) ->
 3343:     ?P("send attempts done: "
 3344:        "~n   Errors:                   ~p"
 3345:        "~n   Number of (inet) replies: ~p", [Errs, NumR]),
 3346:     NumR;
 3347: do_otp_19332_test(S, N, Errs, NumR) ->
 3348:     Packet = lists:duplicate(100, "hello\n"),
 3349:     Errs2  =
 3350:         case gen_udp:send(S, {local, "/tmp/test.sock"}, Packet) of
 3351:             ok ->
 3352:                 ?P("UNEXPECTED SUCCESS (at ~w)", [N]),
 3353:                 exit(unexpected_success);
 3354:             {error, Reason} ->
 3355:                 case Errs of
 3356:                     #{Reason := EN} ->
 3357:                         Errs#{Reason => EN + 1};
 3358:                     _ ->
 3359:                         Errs#{Reason => 1}
 3360:                 end
 3361:         end,
 3362:     receive
 3363:         {inet_reply, S, _Ref} ->
 3364:             ?P("Got a reply"),
 3365:             do_otp_19332_test(S, N-1, Errs2, NumR+1)
 3366:     after 0 ->
 3367:             do_otp_19332_test(S, N-1, Errs2, NumR)
 3368:     end.
 3369:     
 3370: 
 3371: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3372: 
 3373: otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3374:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 3375:     Cond = fun() ->
 3376:                    ?P("cond check: do we support socket"),
 3377:                    case ?LIB:is_socket_supported() of
 3378:                        true ->
 3379:                            ?P("cond check: do we support ipv6"),
 3380:                            ?LIB:has_support_ipv6();
 3381:                        false ->
 3382:                            ?SKIPT("SOCKET not supported")
 3383:                    end
 3384:            end,
 3385:     Pre  = fun() ->
 3386:                    {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet6),
 3387:                    #{local_addr => Addr}
 3388:            end,
 3389:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option(State) end,
 3390:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 3391:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 3392: 
 3393: do_otp_19357_open_with_ipv6_option(#{local_addr := Addr}) ->
 3394:     %% First without specifying the (bind) address:
 3395:     TryOpen = fun(No, Opts) ->
 3396:                       try gen_udp:open(0, Opts) of
 3397:                           {ok, Sock} ->
 3398:                               ?P("success ~w", [No]),
 3399:                               (catch gen_udp:close(Sock));
 3400:                           {error, Reason} ->
 3401:                               ?P("FAILED open socket ~w: "
 3402:                                  "~n   ~p", [No, Reason]),
 3403:                               exit({Reason, No})
 3404:                       catch
 3405:                           C:E ->
 3406:                               ?P("CATCHED open socket ~w: "
 3407:                                  "~n   Error Class: ~p"
 3408:                                  "~n   Error:       ~p"
 3409:                                  "~n   ~p", [No, C, E]),
 3410:                               exit({C, E, No, Opts})
 3411:                       end
 3412:               end,
 3413:     ?P("try wo address (1)"),
 3414:     TryOpen(1, [{inet_backend, socket},
 3415:                 binary,
 3416:                 inet6, {ipv6_v6only, true},
 3417:                 {reuseaddr, true}]),
 3418: 
 3419:     ?P("try w address (2)"),
 3420:     TryOpen(2, [{inet_backend, socket},
 3421:                 binary,
 3422:                 inet6, {ipv6_v6only, true},
 3423:                 {ip, Addr},
 3424:                 {reuseaddr, true}]),
 3425: 
 3426:     ?P("done"),
 3427:     ok.
 3428: 
 3429: 
 3430: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3431: 
 3432: ok({ok,V}) -> V;
 3433: ok(NotOk) ->
 3434:     try throw(not_ok)
 3435:     catch
 3436: 	throw:not_ok:Stacktrace ->
 3437: 	    raise_error({not_ok, NotOk}, tl(Stacktrace))
 3438:     end.
 3439: 
 3440: raise_error(Reason, Stacktrace) ->
 3441:     erlang:raise(error, Reason, Stacktrace).
 3442: 
 3443: local_filename(Tag) ->
 3444:     "/tmp/" ?MODULE_STRING "_" ++ os:getpid() ++ "_" ++ atom_to_list(Tag).
 3445: 
 3446: bin_filename(String) ->
 3447:     unicode:characters_to_binary(String, file:native_name_encoding()).
 3448: 
 3449: delete_local_filenames() ->
 3450:     _ =
 3451: 	[file:delete(F) ||
 3452: 	    F <-
 3453: 		filelib:wildcard(
 3454: 		  "/tmp/" ?MODULE_STRING "_" ++ os:getpid() ++ "_*")],
 3455:     ok.
 3456: 
 3457: get_localaddr() ->
 3458:     get_localaddr(["localhost", "localhost6", "ip6-localhost"]).
 3459: 
 3460: get_localaddr([]) ->
 3461:     {error, localaddr_not_found};
 3462: get_localaddr([Localhost|Ls]) ->
 3463:     case inet:getaddr(Localhost, inet6) of
 3464:        {ok, LocalAddr} ->
 3465:            ?P("found local address: ~s ~p", [Localhost, LocalAddr]),
 3466:            {ok, LocalAddr};
 3467:        _ ->
 3468:            get_localaddr(Ls)
 3469:     end.
 3470: 
 3471: 
 3472: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3473: 
 3474: is_docker(Config) ->
 3475:     case which_label(Config) of
 3476:         {ok, docker} ->
 3477:             ok;
 3478:         _ ->
 3479:             skip("Is not running in a Docker")
 3480:     end.
 3481: 
 3482: has_small_enough_dgram_qlen(Max) when is_integer(Max) ->
 3483:     case max_dgram_qlen() of
 3484:         QLen when is_integer(QLen) andalso (QLen < Max) ->
 3485:             ok;
 3486:         QLen when is_integer(QLen) ->
 3487:             skip("QLen too large: " ++
 3488:                      integer_to_list(QLen) ++ " > " ++ integer_to_list(Max));
 3489:         _ ->
 3490:             skip("Could not get qlen")
 3491:     end.
 3492: 
 3493: -define(QLEN, "net.unix.max_dgram_qlen").
 3494: max_dgram_qlen() ->
 3495:     case string:strip(sysctl(?QLEN), right, $\n) of
 3496:         "sysctl: " ++ _ ->
 3497:             %% Key does not exist...skip
 3498:             skip;
 3499:         QLenAttrStr ->
 3500:             case [string:strip(S) || S <- string:tokens(QLenAttrStr, [$=])] of
 3501:                 [?QLEN, Value] ->
 3502:                     ?P("Max DGram QLen: ~p~n", [Value]),
 3503:                     try list_to_integer(Value) of
 3504:                         QLen ->
 3505:                             QLen
 3506:                     catch
 3507:                         _:_:_ ->
 3508:                             skip
 3509:                     end;
 3510:                 _ ->
 3511:                     skip
 3512:             end
 3513:     end.
 3514:     
 3515: sysctl(Key) when is_list(Key) ->
 3516:     os:cmd(?F("~w ~s", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Key])).
 3517: 
 3518: is_net_supported() ->
 3519:     try net:info() of
 3520:         #{} ->
 3521:             ok
 3522:     catch
 3523:         error : notsup ->
 3524:             not_supported(net)
 3525:     end.
 3526: 
 3527: -define(UNIX(Flavor), {unix, Flavor}).
 3528: 
 3529: is_linux() ->
 3530:     is_platform(?UNIX(linux), "Linux").
 3531: 
 3532: is_platform(Platform, PlatformStr) ->
 3533:     case os:type() of
 3534:         Platform ->
 3535:             ok;
 3536:         _ ->
 3537:             skip("Is not " ++ PlatformStr)
 3538:     end.
 3539: 
 3540: is_not_darwin() ->
 3541:     is_not_platform(darwin, "Darwin").
 3542: 
 3543: is_not_windows() ->
 3544:     is_not_platform(win32, "Windows").
 3545: 
 3546: is_not_platform(Platform, PlatformStr)
 3547:   when is_atom(Platform) andalso is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 3548:       case os:type() of
 3549:         {unix, Platform} ->
 3550:             skip("This does not work on " ++ PlatformStr);
 3551:         {win32, nt} when (Platform =:= win32) ->
 3552:             skip("This does not work on " ++ PlatformStr);
 3553:         _ ->
 3554:             ok
 3555:     end.
 3556: 
 3557: 
 3558: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3559: 
 3560: which_label(Config) ->
 3561:     config_lookup(label, Config).
 3562: 
 3563: config_lookup(Key, Config) ->
 3564:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
 3565:         {value, {Key, Value}} ->
 3566:             {ok, Value};
 3567:         _ ->
 3568:             {error, not_found}
 3569:     end.
 3570: 
 3571: 
 3572: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3573: 
 3574: not_supported(What) ->
 3575:     skip({not_supported, What}).
 3576: 
 3577: skip(Reason) ->
 3578:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 3579: 
 3580: 
 3581: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 3582: 
 3583: %% This is a simplified os:type()
 3584: which_os() ->
 3585:     %% Need this for the error handling
 3586:     case os:type() of
 3587:         {unix, Flavor} ->
 3588:             Flavor;
 3589:         {win32, nt} ->
 3590:             windows;
 3591:         _ ->
 3592:             other % We do not really care...
 3593:     end.
 3594: 
 3595: 
 3596: which_info(Sock) ->
 3597:     which_info([istate, active], inet:info(Sock), #{}).
 3598: 
 3599: which_info([], _Info, Acc) ->
 3600:     Acc;
 3601: which_info([Key|Keys], Info, Acc) ->
 3602:     case maps:find(Key, Info) of
 3603:         {ok, Value} ->
 3604:             which_info(Keys, Info, Acc#{Key => Value});
 3605:         error ->
 3606:             which_info(Keys, Info, Acc)
 3607:     end.
 3608: 
 3609: 
 3610: mq() ->
 3611:     pi(messages).
 3612: 
 3613: pi(Item) ->
 3614:     {Item, Val} = process_info(self(), Item),
 3615:     Val.
 3616:

 3620: start_node(Name) ->
 3621:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 3622:     ?START_NODE(Name, "-pa " ++ Pa).
 3623: 
 3624: 
 3625: stop_node(Node) ->
 3626:     ?STOP_NODE(Node).

 3635: open_failed_str(Reason) ->
 3636:     ?F("Open failed: ~w", [Reason]).
